Reviews.Author: Jin
Reviews.Content: Yes, so this place is quite good. But, It's definitely not a  must-go-back-or-ill-die  type of place.  Pan con Tomate- 5 star (Hate bruscetta but this is a good situation) A selection of all their Spanish cured meats:  I had 5 different hams and chorizo. I only like two a lot. Personally didn't like Iberico Hamon in Spain so this is personal preference.  Endives w/ goat cheese - 4.7 star Patatas Bravas (potato chips w/ spicy tomato sauce) -  3 star Croquetas de Jamon (ham croquettes) - 5 star  Gambas al Ajillo (Garlic shrimp) -  2 star (black poo strings weren't removed. was rubbery. Flavor was bland. It said  very very famous  so i ordered. More like very very typical and plain.  Pulpo a la Gallega (Boiled octopus w/ pee wee patatas) -  2 star  Lightly battered eggplant w/ molasses -  5 star (tastes like sweet potato) Canelones stuffed w/ pork and chicken w/ bechamel sauce -  2 star. Was too heavy for me.

Reviews.Author: Russell
Reviews.Content: Completely unimpressed. Do not be fooled by the Jose Andres name and the website glitz; this is a overpriced, lackluster tapas restaurant in a town where your money will be far better spent at any number of places in walking distance to this disappointment. Wife and I were terribly disappointed. Far from the romantic, fancy, or elegant dining experience we expected.   Décor - Do not come here expecting an elegant or fancy dining experience. Tables and chairs are cheap with visible wear and tear. Restaurant itself is placed in the middle of what can only be described as a strip mall of other restaurants. Deceivingly casual compared to how they market this restaurant online.   Service - While our server was friendly, he lacked professionalism, tried way too hard to be our friends opposed to our waiter, and drew away from our dining experience with cheesy lines and his life story. What's more, we had to listen to him do the same shtick to the tables around us throughout our meal.   Food - we did like the food. The boiled octopus, Ibarra plate, cured black-foot prosciutto, and suckling pig (only available Sundays) were absolutely delicious. The paella however was disappointing and over-salted. Portions were fine, but our biggest gripe was that everything is just far more expensive than it should be for the quality of food offered.   Bottom line, this restaurant's biggest problem is that that the casual décor and mediocre experience do not justify the price point even with decent food. Because you can't come here expecting anything fancy or romantic, your money is much better spent elsewhere.

Reviews.Author: Nicole
Reviews.Content: We had some great overpriced tapas, service was outstanding until it wasn't, and the decor and comfort of the place was suspect.  Let's start with the layout.  there were tables with uncomfortable chairs, or these long couches which went around the restaurant.  The couch things were comfortable if you were sitting back having a cocktail, but not so much if you were trying to eat a meal.  NOT a deal breaker, but weird.  The food -- some of it was great, some of it was ok, all of it was overpriced.  They had a specific vegetarian menu which was really nice.  Made it easier to find the veggie options on their extensive menu.  My friend (the vegetarian) had a goat cheese endive salad which which was divine.  A  warm  spinach salad, which was totally average and these weird eggplant things which were tempura fried and drizzled in honey, which she thought was good, I thought were a complete throwaway.  Three little founds of eggplant, almost tasteless but sweet from the honey for $9.00.  We both agreed it would have been better as a dessert.  I ordered piquillo peppers with a bit of iberico pork lardon, which was probably the best value on the menu.  $6.00 and completely tasty.  But definitely better to split and because of the pork I didn't have a person to share with.  I also ordered a cauliflower, date, olive dish which was divine.  My big splurge was Iberico Pork - which I thought was going to be roasted, but was in fact cured.  It was fine, it was good - but it was $35.00 an ounce.  For $35.00 I want a little more than some dried ham.  It came with a side of tomato bread, which I didn't know when I ordered it.  I HATE tomatoes.  I tried the bread, but I just couldn't do it, so I asked for some plain bread.  When the bill came, I was charged $12.00 for the bread.  TWELVE DOLLARS.    I asked the waitress, who had been stellar to this point, and she said they charge the same price for bread with or without the tomato  TWELVE DOLLARS.    She apologized for not telling me, and I told her I never would have paid TWELVE DOLLARS for bread.  (seriously, 6 slices of french type bread.) and she said she'd see what she could do.  Two seconds later, she was back with the full bill.   Did an an order of $12.00 bread ruin my experience?  Yes, yes it did.  What a stupid thing to upset a customer over.    Oh, I also had a $12.00 sangria.  It was adequate.  There's a place in Winters, I get a superior Sangria for $7.00.    Caveat Emptor.  Would I eat here again?  Before the $12.00 bread, yes.  After the $12.00 bread.  No.  I hope it was worth it.

Reviews.Author: Sky
Reviews.Content: Great tapas!!! Creative food! I try to have a different dish every time I go and I've been happy with every dish!

Reviews.Author: Jen
Reviews.Content: Love, love, love this place! Sat at the bar on a recommendation from a friend, and had a great evening. Our bartender, Jose, was fantastic and made some awesome drinks based upon our personal preferences. He even ordered an array of tapas for us and everything was delicious.  We were there after 8pm on Sunday night, and the bar wasn't overly crowded so we got to chat with all the bartenders and some of the staff. Everyone was great.

Reviews.Author: Christine
Reviews.Content: We eat at the best restaurants around the country and Jaleo just made it to the top. The tapas was amazing - the tomato bread elevated traditional tapas to its very best and I only hope to be able to taste that perfection again.  Then the waiter kindly offered us the rabbit and chicken paella and since we were celebrating my birthday we decided to splurge and get some. At first  we thought the $25 price tag was a little expensive but then we tasted it and realized what a bargain we were receiving! Their paella was smile and perfect in every way.  I couldn't possibly recommend this restaurant more - it was amazing!

Reviews.Author: C
Reviews.Content: Fun atmosphere, the open kitchen was fascinating as huge pans of paella were being stirred. I'm a big fan of tapas, and I have to say the dishes were decent but not the best I've had.  Salmon tartare & trout roe cone - good but the cone was overly greasy. I like fried food, and for some reason this felt heavy, like it wasn't properly drained out of the fryer.  Bacon wrapped dates - again, a potentially great taste overwhelmed by the heavy deep fried grease.  Shrimp & garlic sauce - good  Endive w oranges, feta & almonds - highly recommended!  Skirt steak - my favorite!  Paella - they make fresh batches throughout the night, so whichever kind they prepare at the time is what can be ordered, minimum 3 people, we had the chicken & mushroom - it was good but not impressive  Sautéed spinach - cant go wrong  Fresh oysters - I'm not a fan of them but everyone else at the table thought they were fantastic  Monkfish - sliced thin, like a tartare but cooked, again not a fan of monkfish but everyone else liked it  There were a couple more dishes that I can't remember, but overall a good time. Would I eat there again? Maybe. But I'd probably order differently.

Reviews.Author: Jeanie
Reviews.Content: First of all I wanted to commend the crew on their impeccable service here - they really know how to make you feel special. Somehow this always makes the food taste better! All of the tapa choices for the evening were picked out by our server - how could we say NO to all of her choices -Foie Gras baked with black truffle, prosciutto bruchetta, brussel sprout citrus salad that will knock your socks off, lobster paella, green apple fennel & fig salad, bacon-wrapped figs, exotic cheeses...did I get them all?? WOW - it was richly fantastic. I have discovered a white sangria - and even got the list of secret ingredients! This was a true delight and epicurean journey!

Reviews.Author: Lindsey
Reviews.Content: I don't like tapas. I especially don't like tapas when I'm with coworkers or clients - it's awkward. You order shrimp but there's not enough for everyone. You order steak and someone's a vegetarian. You order soup and then feel guilty for eating the entire bowl yourself.   I'm selfish. I want my food to myself.  But Jaleo changed all of that.   Six of us ordered nearly everything off the menu and six of us wholeheartedly agreed not one thing was under par - instead, every.single.morsel satiated every.single.taste bud. A restaurant has never been so consistently delicious - so on top of their flavors and game that despite our full bellies, when two extra dishes arrived from the chef, we greedily scooped them up. (Chicken and rabbit paella and the chef's new spin on an old standby - garlic shrimp.)   We tried the selection of cheeses and my comrades the three Spanish-cured meats. We shared spoons in the garlic and grape soup (a favorite amongst the table), we slurped oysters, severed mussels, crunched apple/fennel/walnut salad, forked fried eggplant and... more? Yes, much more. The cod and honey empanada that melted once breaking its delicate shell, the homemade potato chips drizzled with spicy tomato sauce, the out-of-this-world garlic shrimp mentioned above and skirt steak (that I can't comment on because I didn't have any).   We devoured every last bit - not a crumb escaped our table. And when it came time for dessert? We split our waitress' two favorites with coffees and espressos.  This is the best restaurant I've ever had the pleasure of eating at in Vegas and one that I will return to again and again - with clients, coworkers, friends or my partner.

Reviews.Author: Henry
Reviews.Content: We had a nice time here. We were going to be climbing at red rocks the next day so didn't partake of the alcohol, and our server was cool about it...the tapas we had wasn't the best choices as a grouping but we enjoyed them. The omelette, called tortilla patatas, was one we liked due to the carmelized onions. They did a good job preparing it. We also had the mushrooms, setas al ajillo, which were tasty. We also had butifarra, which was a sausage stew. Decent enough but nothing spectacular.   Love the ambience and the open kitchen, an overall a great place to people watch and relax. We'd come again and try the drinks next time.

Reviews.Author: Sugar Salt Pepper
Reviews.Content: Creative dishes, we had a little shoe with tapas.  It was very visually appearing including the fire pit and the managers with nice attire but really, if I really put my head into it, I would have gone home to my modern gastronomy and cooked for myself for a way cheaper price.   However, if you want to blow some cash to get some eye visuals, it is great to look at your food and leave hungry for more.  This place to me is for starving models that likes to eat with their eyes.

Reviews.Author: Jessica
Reviews.Content: Our meal started off pretty weak with a soggy tortilla patata, teeny chorizo and a salty paella. I was really disgruntled and ready to leave, but we gave the waiter a chance to suggest food and he made some great choices. After a spinach salad, sliders and some lovely goat cheese we felt satiated. It was definitely not worth the $100 a person though.

Reviews.Author: Sophia
Reviews.Content: I really have mixed feeling about this restaurant. I loved some of the items such as the Almond soup which is out of this world. However the tomato covered bread is just not good!! The portions are way too small. Our first server was not good at all. He had failed to really go through their protocol presentation. It is only through chance that we found out how they normally like to serve the guests. Our temporary server whom we asked to stay on really was amazing. she took her time to explain how they guest will experience the dishes and the history on the chef. This made everything make so much more sense.

Reviews.Author: PAKKLE
Reviews.Content: It was the Wednesday before New Year's Eve and my family and I were looking for a place to grab a late meal, around 9:30 PM or so.  Although we didn't have a reservation anywhere and were a relatively large party (seven of us), we figured it was late enough that we wouldn't have to wait much longer than 30-45 minutes for a table.  My wife and I and our siblings have lived in Manhattan for the past several years, so we were happy to see the list of restaurants at the newly opened Cosmopolitan.  We've been to Blue Ribbon (both Bakery and Sushi), Scarpetta, and Milos in NYC, enjoyed them all, and were confident that the other restaurants in the Cosmopolitan would be of similar high quality.  The first restaurant we saw when we got off the escalator that led up to the dining floor was Jaleo.  It looked great.  An open kitchen sat in the back of a bright and lively room.  The menu was interesting and the dishes sounded delicious.  Philadelphians, imagine a more casual Amada.  We settled on Jaleo and so my wife approached the hostess and asked her if she could accommodate our party.   The hostess looked at my wife and me.  It was immediately clear the calculations that were going through her head: are they good looking enough? do I like their clothes?  do I want them in my restaurant?  Just to give fellow Yelpers some context: my family and I are a reasonably good looking people by any measure and we were dressed casually but neat (ex. Business casual-jeans and no jacket for me).  The hostess glanced back into the dining room and pretended to weigh our options.   Sorry, I don't think we will be able to seat your party tonight.   A large empty table was at the front of the restaurant directly behind the hostess.   What about that one, is that being held?  my wife asked.   Oh it's not being held,  the hostess replied,  but that table would be too small, and also we don't have enough chairs.  And we're closing at 11PM.   The table was set up to seat four, could obviously comfortably seat six, but believe me, in NYC, would have sat eight.  My wife pointed out additional chairs that were unused by guests at other tables.  Another hostess, trying to be more helpful, scurried off to look for a couple more chairs.  The head hostess did not move.   I'm sorry there are just no chairs and we're closing in an hour, I really don't think we can seat you tonight.   We went back and forth like this for about five minutes, the hostess eying us up and down the whole time.    After a while, we left.  I hope at some point the hostess realized that she missed an opportunity for her restaurant to make more money (a group of seven, willing to dine at a table that usually seats four, which probably couldn't be filled the rest of the night).  Actually, scratch that, I hope she stays dumb the rest of her life.  Anyway, we went to Scarpetta instead, where the food was great, the service was better, and nobody made us feel like we were a lesser class of human being.

Reviews.Author: Alexis
Reviews.Content: 4.5     1 star for trying to scale and find this spot in the clusterfuck of the Cosmo in HIGH heels!!!!!   So I've been wanting to come to a Jose andres establishment for a long ass time! We made last minute rsvps and they told us the place was booked by one party and if it was ok to dine in the  lounge  area. Were like sure  no problem.  So we get to the Cosmo and this whole fuggin place is CF! The valet area sucks because the signage confuses the ish out of you. Anywho there was a concert going on and this meant more of a crowd than usual, im assuming. Finally we found the place. One thing im not feeling about these hotel eateries, is the feeling of being in some high end food court. All these places next to eachother and you can people watch the hell of whats going on. Its like a mall for real.    So tip toe over to the hostess desk and they tell us to wait a little and the wait was a little to much for me but the hostess was soooooooooo nice. I must say the staff here are top notch! When we were seated at first I was not feeling this area with straw type chairs and large wooden communal table. It was so uncomfortable but it was what it was. My inner prayers were answered because one of the lovely hostesses told me about the rich folks that booked the whole damn place were leaving YAY! She walked us to our new table and walking there she said we were nice people, im thinking no you guys are!!!! They were so nice and sweet. The best hostesses I've ever encountered!   So now were in those comfy booths. Im sippin on an adult shirley temple and pic a rum and coke with an ice ball. We start scaling the menu and some of the things I wanted the PIC didn't , like the Bikini De Jamón Ibérico, Queso Manchego Y Trufas , he basically called that a ham sandwich and why should we get that LOL. Ok find we didn't get it. So we started with the goat cheese stuffed peppers.  Those were so BOMB but I wish they served 4 of those crack peppas instead of two. Grrrrrrr.  Next dish was the veal cheek with these CRACK mashed potatoes. The potatoes were like silk! Not one lump. Just velvet.  Ordered the garlic shrimp and those were tasty but didn't look like the pics I've seen of this dish but who cares this was good. Next dish was this sausage mushroom stew type dish and that was tasty as well. Very good sausage dish and I love mushrooms!!!!!  One dish that was a lil iffy was the fried chicken wings with this black ink moussey thing brushed around the inside of the dish. That ink stuff was salty blah!  The fried chicken was good but not black peeps good hehe.  One downer is not being able to order the paella of your choice for a small party. You can order what they're making that moment which sucked because I wanted the lobster paella!!!! Not the chicken rabbit one!  Next time I'll show up with a party of 5 and Ill get that damn lobster paella!!!!!!!     We ended the night with the flan. The BEST flan I've ever had NOM NOM NOM NOMMMMMMMMMM!!!!!! I don't want to share that next time :D Damned good and went well with my dessert wine! I will be back here because I want to try more dishes and that amazing service!

Reviews.Author: Emily
Reviews.Content: Jaleo definitely isn't the Bazaar, but it's still a pretty great restaurant by Jose Andres.  In fact, I was really surprised to see some of the items I've had at the Bazaar  on the menu at Jaleo. The waitress recommended that we order 2-3 dishes per person; we had 4 girls, and this is what we ordered:  1. Tortilla de Patata: Spanish omelet with onions and potatoes. Really fluffy omelet.  My friend who loves Spain and Spanish food really enjoyed it, especially since she has had such a hard time finding traditional Spanish Tortillas here in the States.  2. Garlic Shrimp: The sauce was really good, but this dish wasn't all that memorable  3. Patatas Bravas: Jose's version of this traditional Spanish bar food. Basically potato chips topped with spicy tomato sauce and garlic alioli. Really delicious combinations of flavors and textures.  4. Croquetas de pollo:  Chicken fritters SERVED IN A REAL SHOE! just like the Bazaar used to. I was so disappointed to learn that the croquetas at the Bazaar came in 'fake' shoes now. So i was so excited to see these come in a real shoe! The croquetas were AMAZING as well.  5. Rossejat: A paella type dish with pasta, shrimp and squid. Served with an amazing garlic alioli. Definitely comparable to the Rossejat at the Bazaar.  6. Grilled Quail: served with a really great apple puree and pinenuts.  7.Bikini de jamón Ibérico,  queso manchego y trufas: Pressed sandwich with iberico ham, manchego cheese, and truffles. BEST THING WE HAD ALL NIGHT!  8. Olive Oil Ice Cream: Another dish that is also served at the Bazaar. Really interesting combo of flavors. Highly recommend it for adventurous palates and grapefruit lovers.   9. Sangria: Great, but nothing I haven't had before.  Also, this place deserves 5 stars for their service. Our waitress was so sweet and attentive! I had really wanted to try the flan too, but they ran out! It wasn't even that late! I'll definitely be back to try it next time I am in town :)

Reviews.Author: Nancy
Reviews.Content: This might be the favorite of the many great restaurants I ate at in Vegas. The space is beautifully appointed, the food was perfect and beautifully presented and our server, Andrew, was the best. He was especially helpful when it came to making suggestions.   We started with a pitcher of the sparkling white sangria which is prepared table side and has fresh raspberries and blackberries along with some citrus fruit in it. Only the berries find their way into your glass which was nice.   We had chicken croquettes served in a sneaker, quail, chicken with a garlic sauce, patatas bravas, and empanadas for the table. All were good, the empanadas being the only one we wouldn't have reordered had we gone back. They were good, but everything else was better and we'd swap out to try something else.   Andrew was fun and attentive and made sure to pop a candle in our exchange students chocolately good dessert; we were celebrating her 1/2 birthday.  Awesome, awesome, awesome.

Reviews.Author: Keith
Reviews.Content: Walking into this restaurant is quite nice, the decor is nice and they are cooking paella over wood fire in the back which is nice to look at and leaves a great aroma throughout the whole place.  Unfortunately I do not remember all of the exact items we had when I dined here, but I know that almost everything we got was delicious.  I had two food problems when we were there.  First was the roasted pepper and eggplant tasted more bitter than roasted.  Second, In my opinion the grapefruit in the lobster salad was too strong and killed the flavor of the lobster meat.  The restaurant has been described as vibrant and fun but when we went there it was packed and a bit too loud to hold a conversation at our table without shouting.  I have dined at Jose Andres other restaurant The Bazaar in Beverly hills and for similar price I enjoyed the food a little better and the environment and total experience much more.

Reviews.Author: Elizabeth
Reviews.Content: 3.5 stars. Love tapas (a favorite cuisine) and was pleasantly impressed with Jaleo.   Cuisine 4-star Service 3-star Ambiance 4-star Value 3-star  RECOMMEND: - Pan con tomate & Manchego: satisfying crusty bread with delicious manchego. While tasty, this is filling and would not recommend for those interested in trying more dishes. - Tortilla de patatas al momento: cooked to order ftw - Chilled almond and garlic soup with crabmeat and green grapes - Sliced apple and fennel salad with Manchego cheese, walnuts and Sherry dressing: light and refreshing - Warm Brussels sprouts salad with apricots, apple and Serrano ham: satisfying, hearty with the Serrano - Steamed mussels with bay leaf and olive oil: didn't discern the Bay leaf but tasty nonetheless - Seared scallops with pine nuts: delish! - Gambas al ajillo - can't go wrong  Excellent restaurant layout. High-energy, see-and-be-seen, that Cosmo vibe!

Reviews.Author: Jack
Reviews.Content: We had dinner here on a Saturday evening. The restaurant was packed. I muist say that the drinks were outstanding and the food was very competent. Over and above this was a feeling of joy and happiness throughout the restaurant. We literally had a ball dining here and left happy. If you want to have great food and a wonderful time, this is the place to go!!!!!!

Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: Came in on a Wednesday night right at five, which was less busy than the Friday, and ordered lobster paella right off the bat.  My friend and I also ordered jamon and Jose's tuna salad bocadillos to come in between - absolutely scrumptious.  Best sandwiches I've had in town yet.  They come tightly rolled between two baguette-like pieces of bread and pack a powerful combination of flavor and satisfaction.   The paella rice was properly cooked this time around and soaked up the nice lobster flavor well. It also came with garlic mayonnaise which complemented the lobster and rice very nicely.  Service was polite, fast, and friendly like last time. My new favorite restaurant in town!

Reviews.Author: Dina
Reviews.Content: Endivias con queso de cabra y naranjas VERY yummy, Best Fried Dates I've had, manchego apple salad was tasty. Lobster Paella was disappointing. Great service! I will be back!

Reviews.Author: Jack
Reviews.Content: Wow.  Loud.   Service is attentive but a little rushed. Paella was ok...but mass produced and not made to order and devied up table side. Wine list is on iPad and soooo confusing.  Mainly Spanish wines. Everything tasted great.  Don't expect your mainstream Spanish fair.  More eclectic food choices.  Priced right up there to complement the location. Portion sizes are weeeee small. :-/

Reviews.Author: i.am.a
Reviews.Content: Cool place! Cool decor! Beautiful servers! Creative food (in mini-mini portions) Service SUCKS!!!  Go for a drink and some olives, move on to the next place.

Reviews.Author: Mars
Reviews.Content: I heard about Jose Andres from Washington DC, and decided to try out the food while I was gambling.. luckily we won a bunch of money and blew it all on food.   The ambiance was fast paced, noisy, friendly, colorful, just unique. I loved the yuca chips, and decided to try something exotic like a Rabbit short-rib dish. It was delicious. Flavors were different enough, and the Sangria was out of this world.  Our waitress was very attentive! Supposedly his DC restaurant has even better food, and they changed the menus up a bit for Vegas.   In any case I loved the restaurant, the food and the atmosphere was spectacular, can't wait to try out his other restaurants!!

Reviews.Author: P
Reviews.Content: So far, this is one of the best tapas restaurants I have ever eaten. It is more expensive than Firefly. The atmosphere is not better than Firefly. But food is much better than Firefly - and yes, it should be because Jaleo is more expensive.  You kinda have to know what to order to enjoy this place. I go there a lot, so I know what to suggest.   Gazpacho (classic chilled spanish soup made with tomatoes, cucumbers, peppers and bread)  - very smooth and tasty. Refreshing! One of the best gazpacho I have ever eaten.  Ajo Blanco Con Cangrejo (chilled almond and garlic soup with crabmeat and green grapes)  If you like different stuff, you MUST get this. My favorite soup. I get this all the time. Yummy!  Mejillones A La Vinagreta De Miel - (mussels served with pipirrana, sherry dressing and honey)    This item is OK. You kinda be careful when you bite - if you feel it's bad, you should spit it away - because one of 10 mussels could be bad, even rotten. Nobody can tell if it's good or bad - Only your taste buds can tell. So, just be careful. My girl got sick eating one of them.   Pan De Cristal Con Tomate Fresco (toasted slices of uniquely crispy and ethereal bread brushed with fresh tomato) - Start your dinner with this one. Pretty good.  Aceitunas Rellenas Y Aceitunas 'ferrán Adrià' (olives stuffed with anchovy and piquillo and 'ferrán adrià' liquid olives) -    Good stuff! Perfect pair with wine!  Salmón Crudo Con Huevas De Salmón (salmon tartare and salmon roe cone) -this is an unique, small stuff that you can eat as if you are eating snacks or candy bars. Interesting. Pretty OK.   Ostras 'gin & Tonic' (five oysters with lemon, gin and tonic) - one of the best oysters you can get in LV. Much better than Joe's seafood at Caeser's.  Jamón Ibérico Fermín (cured ham from the famous, black-footed ibérico pigs of spain) - If you have never eaten iberico pork, you should try this. Iberico pork is something that you can eat medium rare even if it is a pig!  Chorizo Ibérico De Bellota Fermín (a dry-cured chorizo made with ibérico meat) - I thought it was OK. To me, it tasted too much - I am not a fan of chorizo. If you like chorizo, it should be fantastico!  Santa Gadea Con Albaricoques ((burgos) a soft-ripened organic goat cheese paired with dried apricots) - this is one of my favorites here. You will be amazed how good goat cheese could be! Very tasty and sensitive at the same time.   Huevo Frito Con Caviar (a fried organic egg topped with caviar) - they use good caviar for sure. I'm sure it's the same kind of one they use for  e  restaurant, hidden place in the back (I've eaten there as well - fantastico!)  Endivias Con Queso De Cabra Y Naranjas (endives, goat cheese, oranges and almonds) - one of their BEST appetizers - very refreshing - strongly recommended.  Costillas De Cordero Con Romesco (grilled lamb ribs with romesco sauce and green onions) - this is the only thing that I don't recommend. Not impressed at all. Get something else.  Paellas - all paellas are good - but the traditional paella is so popular that it sells out pretty quick. They sometimes have special seafood/lobster paellas for 45 bucks or so - kinda expensive but it's the best.   If you see my other reviews, you will find that I am a hard rater - I hardly ever rate 5 stars. This place surely deserve 5 stars if you know what to order. I don't care about the dim-lighting for atmosphere at other restaurant - this place is very open and bright so you can take a picture of your loved one! This place (well, entire Cosmo) is pretty loud, but it's worth checking out.   BTW, if you are very conservative on what you eat, then, maybe this is NOT the place. If you like to try new things, if you like to try the best goat cheese, if you like ethnic food, if you are not a grumpy old man, if you are not racist, if you are open in your mind,,, then, this is the place!  Service is very friendly and they are super nice.   My average check is 150 for two including 2 drinks, tax and 20% tips. I've paid only 100 one time including everything. It's all up to your stomach. Not bad for the Cosmo, AT ALL!  You won't regret it if you read my suggestions above!!

Reviews.Author: Benjamin
Reviews.Content: Best sangria I've ever had at a restaurant, hands down. Excellent paella with a wonderful selection of styles available. Service is great. Very lively place to eat. I enjoy sitting at the bar and people watching. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Author: Hayley
Reviews.Content: I really did not like this restaurant, and neither did most of the people in my party. We had 6 of us and couldn't decide what to order so we did the chefs tasting menu. Usually I love this because it gives the chef a chance to showcase his best dishes-- if these were the best dishes then I would not like to see his worst. Everything was salty and unoriginal. I would not come back.

Reviews.Author: Lisa
Reviews.Content: I have eaten at Jaleo twice...and both times GREAT service.  The gin and tonic oysters are a must try!  The ambiance is great and I love how you can see them prepare food if you sit at the bar.  This is GREAT place to go for drinks and a small bite.  But if you SUPER hungry and on a budget I would go elsewhere.

Reviews.Author: Katherine
Reviews.Content: Me & my husband dined here because we were a fan of Jose Andrés. And I must say I will come here again to try some of their foods. For appetizer, I ordered the  Gambas Al Ajillo. It's a very buttery, garlicky shrimp served in a small pan alongside with a bread, almost look like a french bread, but smaller. Taste of the shrimp was phenomenal! Very tasty, oily in a good way. There was some kick to it. At first, I didn't like the bread coz it was too hard to bite, but our server (very knowledgable) told me that I should try to deep the bread onto the sauce so the bread wont be that hard to eat. I love it! Then, I ordered  Presca Iberica Crudo Ahumado  oh boy, I tell you. The slices of meat with its oOh so creamy sauce was very tasty and when I was eating it, I felt some of kind of orgasmic/sexy feeling like you would eat your favorite chocolate on a midnight craving sort of thing. Addicting to eat! Very rich in flavor. Sauce was fantastic, it got some tanginess that balances the salty side of the meat. I will definitely recommend this fine dining resto to my family & friends. Truly, Jose Andres & his amazing chefs put some love & thought to what they are serving to people. Very bold flavors of foods.

Reviews.Author: Jessica
Reviews.Content: Ever know you've hit the right place at the right time with the right attitude? I feel like our visit to Jaleo was a bit charmed. We only went for lunch, but we snared a splendid bartender who served us perfect cocktails, nice conversation and some damn fine food. Admittedly, it's hard to screw up jamon Iberico, but theirs was reasonably priced. The lunch menu is pretty small, but everything is done well. We tried a vegetarian paella and a Serrano sandwich, which came with a tangy and deeply vegetal gazpacho and a wonderfully light salad. As we were soon getting on a plane, we kept the drinks coming and kept getting surprised by how creative and delicious the cocktails were. I have mixed feelings about the Cosmopolitan because it seems to attract a lot of DBs, but it also seems to have some great restaurants. This is a good one, and it may warrant a dinner visit next time I'm in town.

Reviews.Author: s
Reviews.Content: Great food & service! Everything we ordered was not exactly what i expected but was very good! Alot of the dishes are done very unique-either in the presentation or in twist of ingredients! Went with my husband. We were seated next to several other two tops and ended up talking to the tables next to us as well! It would be a great place for a group! Only suggestions is make sure to pack some gum! (Alot of garlic in the dishes)

Reviews.Author: Kwok
Reviews.Content: Second times I am here.  It was a year ago when I first had dinner here.  That meal was expensive which cost me $500 for a party of four.  Tonight's dinner is more reasonable but maybe I am not that into Spanish food and I feel it is just usual.  Not as the first time when I tried it, that memorable.  The service is always good and the decor is wonderful.  But I will probably go try some other fancy restaurant if I am in town next time.

Reviews.Author: Marianne
Reviews.Content: This place was top notch.  It was our first time at a Tapas restaurant.  The restaurant interior is modern  pop culture  and very inviting.  We started out with drinks, obviously, and the Jose Bramble is a must try.  Then we tried the La Peral cheese which comes with almonds and a yummy apricot.  The staff was wonderful.  We continued on with our choices.  My suggestion is go try it yourself and you must order the dates wrapped in bacon.  I recommend not sitting at the Foosball table since the chairs are uncomfortable but it was interesting to see it actually was playable.  Make reservations because it is popular.

Reviews.Author: Joseph
Reviews.Content: I've had better experiences at Chef José Andrés' other restaurants.  Jaleo was a pretty sad experience and definitely not worth the price.  I came here with high expectations due to the reviews.  We came in with a party of 7 people that night and left with fairly mixed reviews.  We were highly suggested to order the chef's experience, $55/$85 which included 10 tapas.  What we did not realize was that they brought out all the tapas on three plates for 7 people.  This meant we did not really even know if they brought out the correct portions or amount of food since they threw it all onto three plates.  For some dishes we only got 2 plates instead of three as they forgot to bring it out.  Some people didn't get some of the extra tapas they ordered and it was a nightmare as they paid for food they did not consume.  The waiters/waitresses made this entire experience very unorganized and unprofessional.    The food did come out in a decently timely manner which was good.  In general I would say avoid the chef's experience.  Although it's 'ten' items, a lot of them are just filler items.  Many of the items tasted overly cooked or almost fermented.  It's really unfortunate as I enjoy Chef José Andrés' other establishments.  I definitely would pass on this experience.

Reviews.Author: Eric
Reviews.Content: Went here with some buddies when we decided to visit the new Cosmopolitan.  Jaleo is like candy.  Candy for the palate and candy for the eyes.  Lots of great tastes and the eye candy walking around this place makes it hard to focus on the food!  I would come here just for Iberico ham and tomato bread but there's so much more.  While the chicken fritters served in a shoe was interesting, the craziest dish was the garlic and almond soup with green grapes.  It sounds like a crazy combination but it worked - earthy, nutty, sweet and tangy, all together.  The only disappointment was the paella.  It is made with such fanfare that you expect it to be great and it's just ... ok.  The tab is quite reasonable for Las Vegas Strip dining.

Reviews.Author: Ramon
Reviews.Content: This restaurant is a little pretentious and pricey. It does have some outstanding dishes and some uremarkable ones. The parkas are imaginative and tasty but rather small for price . Definitely not a good value for your dollar!

Reviews.Author: Jennifer
Reviews.Content: Lord, this place is expensive. A small plate of ham and cheese and several drinks and I was set back over $100 with tax and tip. That said, were I feeling wealthy or out to celebrate, I'd come back again.  Andres does one thing: take great ingredients, present them simply, and charge handsomely for the privilege.   I had the $38 Iberico acorn-fed ham. It was wonderful to try, very marbled and definitely with a distinct nutty flavor, the cheaper selections are no less delicious and I'd order them again over this one.  The bartender steered me away from the  world's best G&T --not so incredibly special. But beautiful.

Reviews.Author: Charles
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure how to start this out. Because after leaving I'm extremely biased in a negative way. I get the whole  tapas  trend with a small plate sharing vibe. But a good tapas place MUST balance pricing with food quality. We get its not about portions at a place like this. But when the SUPER small tapa plates quality is lacking and the price is sky rocketed I'm going to have to complain. Nothing was  to die for  This place charges at a rate of a high priced steak house, for an 8th of the food and disappointment. Maybe I was a little to hungry to be doing this review . So I have to add the service was excellent and you could tell the server understood the disappointment, it's not there fault a bit. But final line this place is a rip off. Go 100 steps to any other direction to get a well balanced meal.

Reviews.Author: Alina
Reviews.Content: Great dinner with friends here our first night in Vegas. Got a table with no wait. Loved the pan de cristal con tomate fresco, patatas bravas, gambas al ajillo, and canelon.

Reviews.Author: San
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed myself here. The Service Atmosphere Food I have not complaints. There was a group of 15 of us and we ordered pretty much a bit of everything and it was pleasing and mouth watering.

Reviews.Author: Lora
Reviews.Content: After going to e' by jose' andre's I had had a hard time letting myself go.  My mistake.  We had a friend who had a friend visiting form out of town and she is a foodie so we decided tapas is the way to go.  We choose right, I will not go on and on about what we chose because the menu does change.  We had an amazing server who could help us choose wine for our palates not for our food she actually had a very good knowledge of wines and it flavors, she choose mine perfectly and gave me the option to change later but I enjoyed it so much I didn't.    Next is food being a newb for the front of the house we needed guidance we asked and she responded.  Boy oh boy did she respond well, every corse we asked about she told us yes or no or guided us to something we may like better.  We loved EVERYTHING the manager even came over at one point and we asked about the Porron http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Porron      it is so much fun and so worth the money a definite must do!!!!!!!  We left so happy we were treated amazing, personable and approached in a way that we felt at home.  We will be back!

Reviews.Author: Wil
Reviews.Content: After visiting Jose Andres' China Poblano here at the Cosmopolitan I thought it would be cool to go to what made him famous, Jaleo. On this occasion it was a early birthday dinner for a cousin with my brother and a out of town friend. In proper tradition we ordered many dished that we would all try out (Spanish Dim Sum LOL!). Service was pretty good, out waitress knew the menu very well and suggested some of her favorites to us, only down part was having to ask for refill various times from the runners.   This is what we had: - Paella Valenciana (Chicken & Rabbit Paella) - Pan con tomate w/ Spanish anchovies (Toasted slices of rustic bread brushed with fresh tomato w/ Spanish anchovies) - Jamón Ibérico - Aceitunas rellenas y aceitunas 'Ferrán Adrià' (Olives stuffed with anchovy and piquillo and 'Ferrán Adrià' liquid olives) - 5 Cheese Queso sampler - Butifarra casera esparracada (Homemade pork sausage stew with mushrooms and pearl onions) - Croquetas de pollo (Chicken fritters) - Croquetas de jamón Ibérico (Traditional fritters with Ibérico ham) - Tortilla de erizos (Spanish omelet with sea urchin) - Salmon crudo con vinagreta de anchoas (Raw salmon with anchovy-lemon oil) - Carne Asada  Everything was very delicious and everyone had a good times and good conversation. Our tab came to about $240 with tip which is about what I expected for a place like this. I was not stuffed but certainly satisfied with the experience.

Reviews.Author: Pamela
Reviews.Content: Despite going back the next evening to let Jaleo know both my colleague & I received food poisoning on 10/2/15 no credit was issued. Sauce came out of plastic containers. I could microwave something & get the same result WITHOUT the food poisoning!

Reviews.Author: Italian
Reviews.Content: Our experience at Jaleo was just OK. Unfortunately, this location is not as good as others we have tried. My expectations were so much higher having dined at the Bethesda location. Unfortunately, the food was lukewarm and was prepared in advance, instead of being freshly made.   In particular, I was disappointed by the paella. The best thing about paella is that it comes steaming hot in a paella pot, with the rice sticking to the pot having a very distinct flavor. It even says on the menu that the waiting time is up to 45 minutes, but our paella came very quickly because it was already cooked in a bigger pot, and it tasted like it was reheated. Our waiter explained that it can be made to order only for parties of 6 or more, so if you are a smaller party it will not be as good.   Overall, our dining experience was good, but based on my experience at Jaleo in Bethesda I was disappointed because I was expecting so much more.

Reviews.Author: Guy
Reviews.Content: Went there Valentine Day  Had seen good reviews  Only a few available tables on open-table at 545p  Not even 4 tables occupied out of 50 when we got there 5:30p  Paleya poor: have had way better  Signature cocktail $20 poor  Only good: Desert Flann

Reviews.Author: Lammers
Reviews.Content: This is not a restaurant for good food, let alone good Tapas.. It is more for people watching. Great ideas with presentation (tapas in a shoe??) and seating, however the food was poor and the portions were very small.  The Paella for example was maybe 1 cup.  What happened to Paella being serve in the pan it was cooked in???? For the price you are paying there are so many other great choices in Vegas. Sorry Jaelo... I would give you no stars if I could.

Reviews.Author: Edward
Reviews.Content: Busy as hell at 9pm on a Friday night. The club next door (Marquee) and the area outside the restaurant are packed with club goers and other party people so expect a lot of energy and noise.  The inside of the restaurant has a clean, open and contemporary feel. Again, it was very busy when I was there so expect to be seated around a lot of other people on a bz weekend. This is not the place to go for privacy or a quiet evening.  The food was very good with my fav being the carne asada. It was marinated very well with a strong kick of salt balanced with oil and cooked medium rare - which i like. My date loved the gambas al ajillo (shrimp), esquiexada, empanada bacalao (Cod puree inside a flaky crust - yum), and the Arroz Bogavante (paella). One thing i didn't enjoy much was cracking open the lobster on the paella with my hands and making a mess. The black bean-ish sauce was pretty amazing though.  This place loses a star (maybe even a star and a half) in my book for two reasons: 1) the wait time to order and the general inattentiveness of our server was abominable; 2) the water they give you is room temperature and nasty... wth.   I guess going for cocktails is the way to go. Grey Goose cocktails are 10 bucks each and just decent. The clementine drop was interesting but not as cool as it sounds on the menu.  All in all, satisfying meal came at a price of a little over a bill. Not bad for 3 small plates, 2 bigger ones, 3 drinks and dessert?  I'm sure my girl and I will be back sometime.

Reviews.Author: Alena
Reviews.Content: Excellent tapas. Been here with a Spanish friend who knows what's best tapas should be like.  The only thing I didn't like are shoes used as a serving plate.

Reviews.Author: Nurys
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend the Jose's way tasting menu! It's a phenomenal value for the amount of food! I lost track of how many dishes they brought out after #8!  They weren't all tiny either.  The food is excellent.  I ate at the bar on a Friday night. They were busy but the staff all made it a point to make sure I was ok. They made a (barely) spicy margarita that was very good - spicy margaritas seem to be rare in Vegas. The wine selection was nice and they let me sample a couple before I committed to one. I honestly couldn't finish the last two plates. It was just too much! The ambience is very nice but a little loud. To be expected at a bar in Vegas. My only complaint was that the wine wasn't served at the right temperature, otherwise everything was excellent!

Reviews.Author: Janaka
Reviews.Content: At $50 a person, I think it's fair to hold this place to a high standard. One of our dishes had literally spoiled, smelled like a barnyard floor, and had to be sent back. The chef admitted it had gone bad. Nothing we ordered attained a rarefied level of culinary excellence or elegance. The service was excellent, and I'm sure fancy people are going to continue spending piles of money here, but for this kind of money I won't be giving them a second chance. Ultimately uninspired.

Reviews.Author: Tracey
Reviews.Content: This was the first time I had ever had dinner at a  high-end  restaurant. It was more like a food tasting party than a fulfilling dinner. All the dishes came in small portions but were very pricey.  The oysters are amazinggg. The preserved raw ham was really good, we had two different kinds, one was from a vegetarian pig, and the other was from a pig that freely ate all sorts of things. We also had the hot dogs which were not like regular hot dogs but tiny ones that were burnt to perfection. We also had the fried rice with rabbit, I am not a big fan of rabbit so I did not exactly enjoy that dish, but everybody else did.  For dessert we had the mango pudding and the vanilla bean ice cream with olive oil. They gave really small portions but it was beautifully crafted and nicely put together on the dish. And I enjoyed everything and the experience for the most part. It was truly an authentic high end Spanish cuisine.  This is also in the new building called the Cosmopolitan in vegas, the place is wonderful and amazing.

Reviews.Author: Deepa
Reviews.Content: I thought it was just okay. The Sangria was really yummy and the service was extraordinary.. that's about it..

Reviews.Author: Menard
Reviews.Content: what i liked:  over easy fried egg with caviar, toasted bread with roasted tomato and anchovy, and the braised veal cheeks... i also had the iberico paella. solid.. the dishes were pretty simple, but you can taste every ingredient all at heightened levels.. i wish i would have paced myself while waiting for the paella...  we were kinda rushing to catch a show. our server went above and beyond to accommodate..

Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: Good ambience and great service. Way overpriced portions are not proportional  to price. The food is lacking flavors on all levels. Overall not worth it.

Reviews.Author: April
Reviews.Content: I don't think this restaurant deserves anything but 5 stars, considering the food, atmosphere, decor, and service.  I came here with my family with a reservation, so I don't know how long the wait is for a walk-in.  I would recommend having a reservation just in case though.  I loved almost all the food we ordered, and I believe we had a LOT of what was on the menu.  I could tell the dishes were very innovative.  Some combinations that I wouldn't ever think would go together complimented each other very well.  For example, dates and bacon.  That pretty much blew my mind.  The tiny little chicken wings were cute, something I've never seen.  They also served an appetizer in their  Spanish  shoes.  Not exactly what the Chinese culture is accustomed to...but I thought it was interesting!  I even had the deep fried shrimp dipped in aioli sauce, and I never normally eat shrimp.   The decor was very modern, which matches the entire atmosphere of the Cosmopolitan.  Even the walls have these dotted patterns on it on a white canvas.  The pillows had colorful different patterns that somehow matched together very well.  My only disappointment:  the main dish, seafood and lamb paella.  I realize that the rice is supposed to be slightly under cooked, but it also lacked in taste.  Overall it was not on par with all the little appetizers we had, and nobody in my family enjoyed it.  What I did love is the fact that when we expressed our opinion about the dish, our server took off one of the orders (since we ordered two dishes).  Considering even my 80 year old, very traditional grandma still liked all the things we ordered, this restaurant is definitely great.  I'm not going to lie, I have no idea what we ordered, but I don't think you can go wrong with all the little dishes.  If anything, it's my favorite way to eat, because you get to taste a little bit of everything!

Reviews.Author: Steve
Reviews.Content: We were a party of 4 looking for dinner.   Walking though the Cosmo we wanted some fun tasty food.  We looked at the menu prior to entering and found the hostesses friendly and quick to help us.  The restaurant was about half full on a Monday night.  We arrived to our table, we sat for about ten to fifteen minutes waiting for someone to say hello.  After being greeted and poured room temperature water we ordered our drinks.  After about twenty five minutes our server took our order.  The menu is a bit different and thought the server should have taken some time to explain the menu and or any specials.  This did not happen.  The server looked and acted like she could care less about us being there.  One person in our party ordered Jose's Patatas Bravas for six dollars.  This was a bag of what appeared to be lay's chips topped with spicy tomato sauce.  What a joke, a bag of plain chips with the empty bag on the side.  My wife ordered the Manza salad which she did not like at all.  She found it to be bland.  The salad was also small but made no difference since she could not finish it because she could not stand the taste.  I had the spinach salad which actually tasted good but for eleven dollars found it to be very small.    My overall perception of the food quality was not great.  We felt as though the server could have been much more attentive as there was very very little interaction with us.   In the end we settled up and left still hungry.  I would not go back.

Reviews.Author: F
Reviews.Content: Iv'e dined at many Tapas restaurants in L.A., even to Firefly in Vegas, but this is by far my new favorite. My sister and I went to Jaleo yesterday and had a visual and taste sensory overload. The ambiance is lively yet intimate, the food authentic yet familiar, and the desserts..omg, the Flan and the Pan Con Chocolate were out of this world.  The best tasting tapas were: 1. Ajo blanco con cangrejo: Chilled almond and garlic soup with crabmeat and green grapes. -TRUST ME- Just order it and thank me later.  2. Croquetas de jamón Ibérico:  Traditional fritters with Ibérico ham and a bechemel cream sauce.  -Can't go wrong here! 3. Empanadillas de brandada de bacalao:  'Empanada' of cod brandade with honey.  -Oh so heavenly 4. 'Esqueixada':   Salad of salted cod with black olives and fresh tomato  -It's not really a salad, more like a dip that comes w/ rustic bread. This was absolutely spectacular, despite the fact that i'm not even a huge fish fan. 5. Canelones tradicionales de cerdo, hígado de pato y trufas con salsa bechamel:   Pork, foie gras and truffle canelones with bechamel sauce. - It  tastes as good as it sounds. 6. Jamón Ibérico de bellota Fermin:  Cured ham from the legendary, acorn-fed, black-footed Ibérico pigs of Spain  - We also got the cheese plate which went very well with our Sangria ;)  7. Mejillones en escabeche:  Mussels marinated in Sherry vinegar - They serve it in a sardine can w/ olive oil and herbs..they melt in your mouth 8. Endivias con queso de cabra y naranjas:  Endives, goat cheese, oranges and almonds -  fun and refreshing  9. Ensalada de coles de Bruselas con albaricoques, manzanas y jamón:  Serrano Warm Brussels sprouts salad with apricots, apple and Serrano ham- its one of their most popular dishes... They have a huge selection of Paella as well, but we were too full by then.  Btw, their Sangria is stronger than you'll think!

Reviews.Author: Jan
Reviews.Content: Spanische Tapas sind ja normalerweise einfache kleine Gerichte, die man in den Bars in Madrid, Sevilla oder wo auch immer in Spanien zum Bier, Wein oder Sherry serviert bekommt.   Jaleo adaptiert dieses Konzept für die Gourmet Cuisine und das Ergebnis kann sich mehr als sehen lassen. Denn natürlich erfährt man hier tolle und auch ungewohnte Geschmackserlebnisse. Aber durch das Tapas-Konzept bestellt man nicht nur ein paar Gänge, sondern pro Person 4 bis 5 Tapas. Und da man alles problemlos teilen kann, kostet man an einem Abend 10 verschiedene wirklich tolle Gericht.   Für alle, die Gourmetküche lieben, ist das perfekt. Wenn auch nicht unbedingt preiswert, aber für schnell und günstig ist das Jaleos auch der absolut falsche Laden.

Reviews.Author: Stan
Reviews.Content: A few times each year we go with friends to try a high-end celebrity chef restaurant. Up until now, we've been disappointed each time. The disappointment ended when we went to Jaleo. The restaurant is up on the 3rd level in The Cosmopolitan Hotel. Riding up in the glass elevator is a great way to start the evening. Ambience: the restaurant is a very open area. On walking in, there is a very handsome bar on the left. Straight ahead is a large open pit area where they cook their meats and prepare Skillets of paella. Whenever a skillet of paella is completed, the chef rings a bell and shouts out something in Spanish. This adds some festivity to the overall atmosphere. In the center there is a glassed-in area where much of the food preparation is done. Try to get a table next to that area. Watching the preparation has high entertainment value. Service: almost immediately after we sat down Mario, a server was at our table to greet us and to help explain many of the items on the menu. So many items sounded so good that we decided to order two tasting menus for the four of us. This resulted in food runners coming to our table frequently and the busboy coming to clear frequently. Additionally, Mario came by frequently to make sure that everything was going well. When we had a minor problem with one dish he corrected it immediately. Service was truly outstanding throughout the night. Food: there was so many dishes on the menu that were new to us that we wanted to try a lot of them. We felt the best way to go was to order two tasting menus for the 4 of us. If it turned out not to be enough, we could always order something extra off the Tapas menu. As it turned out, there was more than enough food for 4 in tasting menu for two. The meal started off with pan de cristal- a tomato bread. This was followed by cana de cabra - goat cheese chorizo. Excellent presentation and excellent taste. The next dish was a small portion of gazpacho. Also outstanding. Next came the endive orange goat cheese salad. Very light and tasty, perfect for a warm summer night. This was followed by a very small cone filled with veggies and topped with an anchovy. I'm not a big fan of anchovies. My wife, who is a fan, said it was delicious. The next courses included mushroom croquettes, a watermelon salad, a halibut tomato squash stew, and Carne asada. Each dish was better than the last. Then came the chicken and mushroom paella. Phenomenal!! For dessert they serve the chocolate custard. Value: wonderful ambience, fabulous service, and phenomenal food, all for $75 a couple. This has to be the very best value for food in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Author: Manda Bear
Reviews.Content: ************************** 537 ****************************            I've been dining at Jaleo back in the day when it was at original location in Crystal City, Alexandria, VA (right at borderline of DC). Love the casual touch and the tapas style of place. Can go wrong with chef Jose Andres on some of these dishes:  - Salmon crudo - fresh and tasty!  - Chicken croquettes - crispy outside and perfectly juicy inside.   - Rabbit Confit - tasty yam, perfectly cooked.  - Endives, Goat Cheese, Oranges - light and refreshing.  - Uni with  peppers, tomatoes, pomegranate foam - interesting twist, worth to try.  - Spanish charcuterie - try this!            Wine list with majority of Spanish and European wines as expected. Sangria is something you should try here! Decent price point for Vegas standard. Service was slow at time, wonder if it was because 2 big conferences were here APEX and National Broadcasting Association! Again, it's a decent new operation, so I would come back when it sets in at Cosmopolitan Hotel.  Overall: 4 stars For value: 4 stars For Food: 4 stars For Service: 3 stars Ambiance: 4 stars For Location: Inside Cosmopolitan Hotel, on the strip.

Reviews.Author: Ken
Reviews.Content: I have heard so many good things about this place, had to give it a try  UGH, expectations are a bad thing to have sometimes....  ordered a few dishes started with the cheese plate selection....bad the one that sticks out was a goat cheese brie???? positively awful, kind of what I would imagine a urinal cake tasting like....had to spit out in napkin...that bad  went on to apple and fennel salad, again bad choice not sure how you screw up this one, maybe a bit heavy handed with Sherry/vinegar? in any case, sent this back as well  third, tried the cauliflower, which was cooked ok, but the dusting of paprika kind of killed the taste for us  fourth came the lamb, probably the only edible dish of the night, cooked well, but a bit heavy handed with the salt.....edible at least  fifth, the paella with various vegetables, which they told us into our meal was not available (went bad?) offered us the remaining available one, chicken and rabbit, but by that time we were pretty much done with this place, and why take the second best of only two choices of paella available that night?  I can say that the service was decent, and that even though we did not have a good meal....or any meal at all, the manager was extremely attentative. It was refreshing that he came to our table after the first two dishes were taken away and he noticed we had not touched much of either. I really hate to give the place such a low rating based on his concerns. Not too many places would show such concern, and especially on the strip, most would probably have just let us suffer. He took care of the check as well, which was appreciated.  I have had friends rave about this place, so maybe in future we might give it another shot, but there are so many choice in Vegas now, hard to give this a second try.......

Reviews.Author: Matthew
Reviews.Content: Jaleo at the Cosmopolitan is one of José Andrés' restaurants. They have a very good selection of tapas and wines that will pair off well with all of the different food items. Paella here is made over a wood fire. Large groups can get an entire pan of paella, but if just 1 or 2 people you'll be limited to the paella selections of the day that are available for smaller groups. I had a paella that had rarebit and chicken. It was very tasty and flavorful, but the one thing to watch out for is that they serve in the traditional style of bone-in the meat. Service here was very good, too.

Reviews.Author: Lucio
Reviews.Content: Food and atmosphere were terrific but the true stand out - the gin and tonic. Easily the best G&T I've ever had in the States. Large ice cube (a must in a good drink) and perfect combination of good gin and a crisp tonic. At $20 a pop it is a splurge (funny, it only costs $14 at Jaleo in D.C) but worth the indulgence.   As for the food, the tapas we ordered were all good. Chorizo and manchego cheese cut perfectly and flavorful. So too was the tomato bread.  The croquettes were as described ('a chicken pot pie in every bite ) but I do wonder why it came served in a sneaker. No need for gimmick when you have food this good.  And, lastly, the service was spot on. Nice to have a server with an opinion. Trust the staff to lead your way and stretch yourself to try things you may not have in the past.   Overall, great experience and would def. return.

Reviews.Author: Kathryn
Reviews.Content: We had a group of 14 girls come to Jaleo on a Friday night for a bachelorette party. Our server warned us that the plates were small but meant to be shared, which to me was a little confusing, but we went with it. I split an order of the garlic shrimp and the green beans with goat cheese with a friend and can honestly say I needed something more. If I wasn't splitting I would have been totally satisfied but he said they were meant to be shared so I did. I didn't have a drink but a few ordered the Bramble (lavender something?) and said it was really good. One person ordered the chicken fritters and they came out served in a shoe... Weird. Our server did mess up one order and apologized because he thought she pointed to something else, and left the wrong dish for us to enjoy on the house. Everyone loved their dishes but we all agreed that we wished they were bigger. They also have a separate gluten free menu, which worked out nice for a few of our girls.

Reviews.Author: Karla
Reviews.Content: I was in Vegas for a conference earlier this week. My colleague and I stumbled across Jaelo as we were walking through The Cosmopolitan. Quite frankly we chose it because of the funky, interesting atmosphere.  But wow...the FOOD. Every single thing we tried was amazing...the garlic shrimp, skirt steak, veal cheeks...all of it. And the servie was great.  I would recommend and definitely go back again.

Reviews.Author: Patrick
Reviews.Content: Excellent food and great service.  Once the management found out we were locals they took extra steps to make sure our dining experience was a good one, even bringing over a complementary dish from the chef.  It is nice to see a strip restaurant care about local clientele! Highly recommend the scallops, they were perfectly cooked.

Reviews.Author: Martin
Reviews.Content: This place just looks like fun from the outside; the tables spill into the surrounding area like a Spanish sidewalk cafe. We get inside and it is loud, boisterous, as if to say,  come partake in the Fiesta of food.   The waitress is great, making recommendations; we start with the sangria, oh so good.  We try an assortment of plates and flavors:  Bread w jamon serrano, paella with lobster (somehow I expected more lobster on such an expensive portion) Beet salad and Carne asada Chorizo wrapped in potato chip: mildly spice, sorry to say it reminded me of pigs in a blanket, only crunchy.  Chocolate flan w olive oil drizzle--very yummy!  Really enjoyed this place, but I still think Firefly has better food if you are willing to go just slightly off the strip.

Reviews.Author: alex
Reviews.Content: Terrible service, server never showed up, food was ok, nothing out of the ordinary.... the table next to us got their meal comped because of the same issue. the oysters gin & tonic, they sound good but flavor was awful....also, sangria had no flavor....  Overall, terrible experience, we'll never go back.

Reviews.Author: Ace
Reviews.Content: I liked the food, the attitude of the waitress and the overall experience, but this place is very average for the money you pay. For instance, I didn't feel like there was anything special about the appetizers. Their main rice dish was really good though, and I'm craving it right now.  Typically, in Vegas you pay a lot more for the same stuff you could get anywhere else, but sometimes you feel like, oh I might as well spend a few bucks more and get something excellenter. If that rambling makes any sense.

Reviews.Author: Daniel
Reviews.Content: Wow, after coming here to eat tapas I felt like this place punched me in the face and stole my wallet. I have eaten tapas in California and Florida and this place does not compare to any of the local places at a fraction of the price. The food was salty and really nothing special in comparison to my experiences elsewhere. We were a party of six and after spending $70 per person we were still hungry. Since we were unsatisfied we had to go somewhere else so we can complete our dinner.  Do yourself a favor and eat somewhere else. After eating at Jaleo I read the reviews and agree with all of the negative responses.  To the Jaleo GM or marketing person responding to my review do yourselves a favor and fix this issue. Sending you an email on what my issue are will not do anything since my negative reviews reflects other on Yelp and you still have not fixed the problem.  Good luck!

Reviews.Author: Tracy
Reviews.Content: One of the better tapa joints in Vegas.  Although, don't know what the heck happened.  They got rid of a bunch of their original dishes which were amazing!!!  Drinks are pricey but yummy...

Reviews.Author: Carrie S.
Reviews.Content: The ambiance is lively and fun, but the food is just average.  We even had to return a paella due to it being undercooked.

Reviews.Author: Kari
Reviews.Content: Came here during our bachelorette weekend o' fun. Was a little sad they didn't do anything to make the bride feel special. At one point the guy clearing dishes dropped a fork right on my friend's head. I think it fell tine side down because she was in pain for a little while. Also unimpressed that they didn't do anything to make up for that. But the food here is good. And some of it is super delicious.   Caña de cabra con higos - Amazing. Super delicious. Order it. Patatas Bravas - Also quite tasty. This was by far the best 'bang for your buck' of the plates we got. Chorizo casero con puré de patatas al aceite de oliva - The potato had better flavors than the chorizo. I don't know if that speaks to how amazing the potato puree was or if the chorizo was a little tame. Gambas al ajillo - I don't eat shrimp, but my friends said the sauce that came with this was some of the tastiest of the meal. They were sad to not have bread or something to soak up the rest of it. I'm realizing as I look at the menu that they brought me the wrong tuna. No wonder I was disappointed. I thought someone must have eaten the goat cheese before it got to me, but no. I never even got what I wanted. :/ Anyway, I ordered Ensalada de mojama con caña de cabra, but I got Atun con ajonjoli y piquillos confitados instead. It was okay, nothing special.  Endibias con queso de cabra y naranjas - Fine, but I would suggest trying one of the other verduras options. I feel like the apple and fennel would be a more interesting one to try next time. Paella Valenciana 'Rafael Vidal' - Good. I'm not super familiar with paella so I can't speak to how it compares to others, but I would order this again.

Reviews.Author: Liz
Reviews.Content: Everything we ordered was executed perfectly.  Wish I could try more items on their menu...  Croquetas de pollo that come in a shoe is a must.  Flavor is just out of this world.  House made chorizo dish was also ridiculously yummy.  Only disappointment was that the kitchen served 2 paellas at a time during the course of the night.  Wanted to try the seafood ones but wasn't available.  Damn it!!!!!!! Heads up, the insanely yummy garlic aioli that comes with the paella will leave your breath very garlicky, so if you're going to kiss someone, make sure they eat some too.

Reviews.Author: RJ
Reviews.Content: Very suprised at Jose Andres , not that I expect him to be overseeing things but it could be much better.  I liked the layout of the restaurant, that's about it.  The Sangria was watered down red wine. The  Jose's gin n tonic $17  was nothing special. Pulpo $12 for 10 nickel-sized pieces was served with no seasalt at all, I would've added my own if there was salt around anywhere. I asked for some bread and got three triangle pieces, ok . Then I saw $3 on the check for bread ????  The Paella Iberico was extremely salty $36 for a Tapa.  Two people $251.00 plus tip.  Very overpriced for what is served.

Reviews.Author: Kyle
Reviews.Content: Watch your bill!!!!! Menu showed $15 and they tried to charge us $20 for an appetizer..Usually I don't even look,however my buddy has a sharp eye. Food was good, service was good, however I won't ever be back because of this error. This is totally unacceptable. This isn't a third country.  I don't know if this is a scam by employees or just a simple computer error, but it doesn't matter, both are completely unacceptable business practices. Upon observing management interaction with other patrons I'm going to guess this goes high up...welcome to 'the strip'

Reviews.Author: Standards
Reviews.Content: I've had quite a few amazing tapas experiences in my day so Jaleo really had big shoes to fill in terms of leaving me wowed.  I did enjoy the open concept floor plan so we were able to see all the chefs hard at work.  However, the weird bull thing hanging on the wall was just that, weird.  Then there was the picture of the sleeping woman on the other wall.  I guess I felt like the decor didn't make any sense (I'm not an interior decorator so take it with a grain of salt), it was just a bunch of random stuff put here and there.  Perhaps I would have been more into the decor if the rest of the experience had been more impressive.  Anyway, the food was not terrible by any means.  The chicken fritters (served in a shoe, WTF?) and the  huevo fritto con caviar  were both quite memorable and delicious.  Lucky me, my hubby is allergic to fish so I was able to enjoy, or should I say devour, the egg/caviar dish on my own.  The rest of the items we ordered ranged from ok to good.  I guess where I was really let down was the high price of everything compared to the lack of wow factor.  Don't get me wrong, I'm fully aware Vegas can be very pricey but if I'm going to pay top price I want a top notch experience.  Given that we ate at my favorite tapas restaurant in Vegas the very next evening, got twice the amount of food and liquor, and still paid about 1/3 of what we paid at Jaleo, I can't give them any higher than 3 stars.  Also, since we had such an amazing experience at a few of the bars on the first level of Cosmopolitan,  I was expecting more from Jaleo.

Reviews.Author: Kwiri
Reviews.Content: Yes... I would plan a trip to Vegas JUST to try Jose Andres!  Not sure how I can review Jaleo...  The service is excellent as always with all the Jose Andres staff but in terms of food, I was bit disappointed.   Las Vegas... in the best Cosmopolitan Hotel, I expected slightly more...  The highlight on the menu really was the most plain items on the menu:   Pan con tomate, Toasted slices of rustic bread brushed Pasamontes Manche & Croquetas de pollo Traditional chicken fritters. Yes... It came out in a shoe and kept me entertained.   The soup Gazpacho de remolacha con queso de cabra y naranjas, Chilled red beet soup with goat cheese and oranges definitely acquire unique taste... It was interesting.  The ambiance is interesting but I still would put Baazar at SLS hotel in beverly hills way above Jaleo. ( Sorry guys!)  I'm definitely interested in going back to try e by Jose Andres though.

Reviews.Author: Judas
Reviews.Content: My first visit to this place was underwhelming. Yet, I have heard many positives about this joint, so I decided to give it another go. Unfortunately, it was much of the same. I have not had a bad dish yet, but nothing has come close to being great. The atmosphere is the same boring chic style that you find all over the Strip now. (Is there one guy doing all of these restaurants? I really do not get the appeal. Maybe I am just not hip anymore.) I had very good service on both visits. For my money, I would do up Firefly, have a more comfortable experience, great tapas, and save some dough.

Reviews.Author: Lauren
Reviews.Content: On a random Saturday night in May we decided to meet some friends for tapas on the strip. This place is pretty good. It is also super popular! We arrived at 8pm and left around 1 and there was still a line to get in.   We basically tried one of everything and it was all good. I really enjoyed the bread with tomato on it and some chicken. My favorite was the sangria! It had mint in it which was a different touch that I will be adding to my sangria now!

Reviews.Author: Albert
Reviews.Content: A crowded, happening, popular place.  Yes, it can be noisy, and yes, your server may disappear for longer than you might like on occasion, but I had a very good time here.  My companion may differ - being not a fan of Spanish food in general, and feeling a little off that night - but I enjoyed everything I had here quite a lot.  This is not Jose Andres the molecular guy - this is fairly straight forward tapas done extremely well.  They and serious here - for instance they have what they claim is the only indoor wood-burning Paella setup in the US right in the center of the restaurant.  The paellas are made in rotation - only one flavor offered at a time, though if you sit around long enough, they'll rotate through to another one.  We ended up with a lobster paella - served with pieces of lobster on top - quite good, though I have never seen paella here with the crusty bottom.  A little wine, gazpacho, tomato bread ( really a pizza ), an assortment of jamon, salted potatoes - simple things for the most part, but each done really well and presented creatively.  There's a reason for the crowds.

Reviews.Author: Myra
Reviews.Content: We came across Jaleo on our 2nd night in Vegas and I was so glad to have found a tapas place. Although my husband was a bit hesitant at first, since the menu's a bit overwhelming for a newcomer, we were pleased with our choices. We especially liked the Paella with shrimp and squid, with an amazing & intense mix of flavors. The warm Brussels sprouts mixed with apricots, pears, & jamon was a perfect blending of a dish! As a kid, I hated Brussel sprouts, and this dish definitely turned me into a fan. Perfect portions & great food to be shared!

Reviews.Author: Kandace
Reviews.Content: We tried like 20 different things on the menu between a group of 8 of us and every single thing was delicious. The atmosphere is fun and our server was awesome! Will be coming back for sure.

Reviews.Author: Tina
Reviews.Content: Wow this place was absolutely amazing! All the food just melted in your mouth to perfection! I was super impressed. One place with great service great drinks AND superb food?? Yes, they had it all!  I would definitely recommend this place for good drinks and snacks...(I say snacks because the portions are all smaller then appetizer size) but totally worth it.  It was fun it was a very social place and I might hit this place before I go clubbing from now on ;)

Reviews.Author: Roy
Reviews.Content: Went to Jaleo with high expectations. Ordered various tapas and the  paella feast .  There were one tapa that we enjoyed. The radicchio with goat cheese. The bread that came with the garlic was also decent. The other dishes were either unremarkable or excessively salted. The paella and the octopus were two that were over salted. The rice had a nice bite but the salt overwhelmed the dish. Very disappointing. All you could taste were essentially the salt. Expected much more from an Jose Andres branded restaurant. The ingredients of the paella were also unremarkable: chicken and mushroom. The other tapas and dishes we had: the skirt steak, the gazpacho, garlic shrimp and others were unremarkable. Don't have high expectations if you go. The sangria was also unremarkable.

Reviews.Author: Simchok
Reviews.Content: Excellent food, wine and service. However, if you do not like Spanish cuisine, then this is probably not the place for you. While it is not traditional, it's still Spanish enough; which for us is Heaven! Jose Andres is a genius and Jaleo is a masterpiece. We dine here every time we are in Vegas.

Reviews.Author: Mihir
Reviews.Content: Great vegetarian options & non alcoholic drinks. The service was great. The ambiance was energetic & nice. We had a virgin margarita, virgin sangria (they make the sangria fresh daily & keep a non alcoholic batch separate), rosemary lemonade, pan con tomate, paella verduras, escalivada catal & sopa gazpacho. All the food was good. Vegetarian items are marked well & there are vegan options too.

Reviews.Author: Bowdoin
Reviews.Content: I had a friend who had eaten here recently and after I was raving about Julian Serrano's tapas in the nearby Aria, wanted me to go here to compare.  Short answer:  Go to Julian Serrano's instead.  The restaurant seem like a hip place with modern décor and had a fun atmosphere.  After perusing the menu, we opted for the beet salad, lamb chops, paella valencian (with beans, rabbit and chicken), salmon with cauliflower, jamon iberico, and pan con tomato (bread with tomato).  The beet salad was very unremarkable and the beets weren't very tasty.  The lamb chops were cooked perfectly, albeit overseasoned.  There was a mint sauce that looked nice but didn't add much in terms of flavor.  The paella was very uneven.  The chicken was well cooked and juicy, but everything else was disappointing. The beans were overcooked, the rice was undercooked, and the rabbit was overcooked.  The salmon with cauliflower was slightly undercooked (that didn't bother me) but the skin was just way too salty.
