They used saffron in it too which u can see. The paella was a decent portion so we did all get full by the time we finished our dessert. The flan was creamy and not gelatinous which I find most flans. We also got the chocolate mousse which we demolished. The candied crispy bread that came with it was super crispy and delish! Def will revisit next time I'm in Vegas.

Reviews.Author: Richard
Reviews.Content: Another Jose Andreas restaurant we had the privilege to try on our short Vegas trip.  Its Spanish fare served tapas style.  I like the feel of the atmosphere which felt festive to me.  There is a small bar area to the side which is where we sat and towards the back is a large open fire which is used for cooking.  I like the fact the bar doesnt have thousands of different types of liquor, its more simplistic but has all the necessities.  They have a handful of specialty gin and tonics which my girlfriend insisted we try (she had been there before and was impressed) and they tout as the best Gin and Tonics you will have have.  We ordered the Citrico and the Hierba. They were not wrong, these were the best Gin and Tonics I have personally had.  The taste of each was simply amazing.  Foodwise we had the Paella Del Dia, the Chorizo ibérico de bellota Fermín, and the selection of Cheese de Jose.  Everything was very fresh and had wonderful taste.  This is a restaurant I look forward to revisiting next time I am in Vegas.

Reviews.Author: Jen
Reviews.Content: If you come full, you are on the right path as there was only one dish we ordered that was good.  We were aware of the expense but having to order 3 dishes per person to feel as though you've eaten a granola bar is not worth the cost.  Here is the good/bad to what we ordered:      Espinacas a la catalane, 12.00 - sautéed spinach, pine nuts, raisins and apples - decent if you are a fan of EXTREME salt which oddly enough grew on us likely due to our starvation.  Sangria de Vino Tinto, half carafe, 25.00 - basic sangria, nothing special, not worth the cost.  Rabbit Paella, 32.00 - burnt rice, rabbit did not taste great. Due to the expense/bad taste, this dish should be eliminated.  Chicken croquetas, cannot recall the cost - BEST dish we ordered, would recommend.

Reviews.Author: Anastasia
Reviews.Content: Our night at Jaleo was a harmonic convergence of great food, great friends and great fun. Our reservation for six turned into a reservation for four. We called in the afternoon to advise them of the change, but couldn't reach a human so we mentioned it upon our arrival, which wasn't an issue. The restaurant itself is very loud and it opens into the even louder second floor of the Cosmopolitan, so leave Grandma and Grandpa at home, because they won't enjoy the noise level.  The prices are usually noted as being on the expensive side, but four of us ordered everything that we wanted, including alcohol, and the bill came to exactly $200.  Every dish was great. One of them we ordered a second time because the first one was so tasty. Really helpful service. I advised of my allergies only once, and had no problems all evening. We didn't feel rushed in the least, although the place was packed the entire time that we were there.   Highly recommended for a really fun night out on the strip.

Reviews.Author: J
Reviews.Content: Ausgezeichnete Tapas, alles wirklich empfehlenswert.  Zuvorkommende Bedienung. Sensationell: Flan mit Crema catalana, als Dessert Weltklasse !! Achtung: Tapas!, d.h. Pro Person ca3 bis 4 Gerichte auswählen und dann am Tisch teilen.  Ambiente etwas zu laut (Musik) für den Preis, aber   cool , Gerichte werden live zubereitet, teils am offenen Feuer.  Weinkarte per IPad, naja, aber: funktioniert. Insgesamt eine Empfehlung

Reviews.Author: Patrick
Reviews.Content: Oh Jaleo, you bring out the worst in me.  I'm one of those eaters that: (1) has zero patience to read a menu, especially when most of it is in a foreign language; (2) if I can't decide what I want, I pester the server and neighboring diners for recommendations; and (3) knows exactly what I want and how I want it.  Jaleo, for better or worse, hits all four proverbial nails.  Jaleo's menu isn't the biggest, but there are a large number of dishes offered.  And most of it is in Spanish.  Unless you read the English description.  Well, as I said before, I have no patience to read every description to settle on a handful of openers.  Which sucks because we ended up with the cod empanadas, which, oh, btw, doesn't really have any cod in it.  It's basically a fish cream that's been deep fried in thin and crisp empanada shell with some honey drizzled on it.  You might like it and love it, but my friends and I could not stomach this to save our lives.  We Fear Factored the shmuck who ordered it as punishment.  Yes, he smelled like fish after that.  The menu doesn't suck if you read Spanish.  Or you have the patience to actually read everything.  Deal killer?  Nope, because...  ...I pester people to give strong recommendations.  Sucks for everyone else except me!  Using this method, we stumbled across a ginfully good Gin & Tonic.  They ship their ice sphere (don't call it a ball) from their sister ship in LA.  Seriously.  The care and attention that goes into this one drink suggests that they care about all of their products (apparently even that cod cream).  Speaking of attention, the food in the shoe definitely grabbed ours, as we promptly ordered the delectable pollo croquetas (sp?) that occupy the footwear.  Those little morsels of what tasted like really good creamed chicken in a crunchy fried shell are really yum.  Another great recommendation was that we try their off-menu paella (I don't know what it's called because we said we'd take it before the server even described it).  To our surprise it was loaded with a whole lobster tail, a giant lobster claw (a bitch to break open), a few prawns and a few muscles.  Killer good that dish, but...  ...not as good as the Iberico Short Rib Paella recommended on my first visit.  It was so rich and tasty that we wanted another plate.  I daydream about it.  I drool uncontrollably.  My second visit to Jaleo was specifically to have this dish again.  Upon sitting, before ordering drinks or even water, we asked for, nay DEMANDED this paella.  To which our humble server replied they were not going to be making it.  At all.  For the rest of the night.  Once the tears stopped, I pulled myself together with a wonderful Gin & Tonic, had some pretty good dishes (like the potato wrapped chorizo and roast quail) then went over to Blue Ribbon for oxtail fried rice to dull the pain...but that's for another review.    Yeah, Jaleo, you've got a lot going for you.  Your food's mostly good.  But I think I need Rosetta Stone and some valium to get through the menu.  And you need to get some more damn Iberico short ribs for the best paella in the world!

Reviews.Author: Addy
Reviews.Content: I can't decide whether to give this place 3 or 4 stars.  I guess I will round it up.  Jaleo is the place my boyfriend took me for our anniversary.  We came here on 7/25 for dinner.  PAN DE CRISTAL CON PASAMONTES MANCHEGO $12 Delicious.  Really authentic light and crispy toast with a fresh tomato paste and a slice of thin manchego cheese.  Just wish we could have gotten more for the price.  CROQUETAS DE POLLO $12 My favorite.  Delicious croquetas with chicken.  They even came in a little shoe.  Strange, but definitely interesting.  Only 5 in an order.  CALAMARES A LA ROMANA $12 Eeek.  Well this popped my food-sending-back cherry.  As a server, I have never sent back food.  But even my boyfriend couldn't eat this and we both love calamari.  It was extremely chewy/rubbery which means it was overcooked.  BUNUELOS DE BACALAO $14 Yum!! I couldn't get enough of this.  I didn't really know what to expect when ordering this so I was surprised when it came out.  It is like little fried balls of creamy codfish.  The honey aioli was so good.  Very rich flavor.  PAPAS ARRUGAS $8 How can you go wrong with potatoes? Yum.  CARNE ASADA CON PIQUILLOS JULIAN DE LODOSA $18 So good.  Cooked perfectly.  MINI PEPITO DE IBERICO $8 I thought my boyfriend was going to die happily once he bit into this.  His favorite part of the meal.  We also ordered a sangria ($12) and a cocktail ($16).  I'm going against the odds and saying I did not like the sangria.  I felt like I was back in high school and had to plug my nose, down this, and then chase it with my water.  I don't remember which cocktail my boyfriend ordered, but when it came out I was very confused.  It literally looked like a SHOT.  Not a cocktail, but a shot.  There must have been 2-4 oz at MOST.    The service was okay.  We had a really hard time finding our server to tell her about the calamari/get our check.  She took it off our bill without a problem, which we appreciated.  So all in all: I would come back.  But maybe on a half full stomach.  The portions are way smaller than tapas.  Some are bite sized.  And it is extremely overpriced.  Our bill was $120ish and we were still hungry.  Not a good feeling to pay this much and leave hungry.  We were highly considering going to get a slice of pizza at Secret Pizza but had a show to go to. (Which we wouldn't have been late to if it didn't take our server 15 minutes to drop the check). BUT the food was very good.

Reviews.Author: Bryan
Reviews.Content: I was there in December when the place had just opened. Everything ran smoothly and the service was great.  It was pretty lively and energetic in there with people filling the entire restaurant. Not a quiet place but a good place for drinks and tapas.  Everything we ordered was fantastic. I even had some pulpo (octopus)! The jamon was delicious and imported from Spain, I believe. Mmm. The sangria was also very, very good.  They ran out of a bunch of the desserts we wanted so they eventually ended up comping the two desserts we finally selected that they did have.  The food also inspired me to visit the bazaar in LA. If you're in LA, check it out -- I think it's even better than Jaleo.  On the pricey side - I believe for about 5-6 tapas and some sangria it was around $125. If you have the cash to spend, it's totally worth it, though!

Reviews.Author: Bonobo
Reviews.Content: Surprised by the mixed reviews. Had a phenomenal dinner here. The shrimp, cheeses, patatas bravas were the highlights. Great service to boot. Definitely the best of the 4 Cosmopolitan restaurants we tried.

Reviews.Author: Ravi
Reviews.Content: 3rd level of Cosmopolitan.  Supposedly a famous chef, but I dont generally have any idea, as my wife picks these places. We had a special tasting menu called  Jose's way . This included a chilled almond soup (very good), manchego cheese (so good, that we had to look up what this cheese was - found some online and bought it as soon as we got home); a very thinlyl sliced plate of iberian ham (so thats what people talk about); paella; and a few other things that I cant remember, except that they were very tasty. Small quantities, and not too filling.  Its expensive, but the food is an experience that you cant get in too many places.  I also took a wine pairing and was introduced to a few kinds of very expensive, and tasty wines, that I had never heard of before.  So, overall, a good experience.

Reviews.Author: Tami
Reviews.Content: Jaleo was terrific. Great atmosphere in the heart of The Cosmopolitan's foodie scene.  The center of the restaurant is a $2 million grill/open flame where they grill meats & veggies and make a mean paella!  We started with a bottle of cava (of course) and went on to enjoy several tapas for the table. We especially loved the verduras asadas, patatas bravas, paella (pork), and the gambas.  The only dish we did not love was the jamon iberico fermin which was a bit fatty and lacking in flavor. (However, the aged ham in the verduras was amazing)  Really fun dining experience!

Reviews.Author: Jeanne
Reviews.Content: We decided to visit Jaleo during our trip to Vegas to celebrate a friends birthday.  We were seated outside of the restaurant in the pathway of the  mall  it was located in and this was very strange.  I understand that Tapas is small plates but these were micro plates.  The food itself was just average.  The service was very slow and they  accidentally  overcharged me by $100.  Will not repeat.

Reviews.Author: Taylor
Reviews.Content: Plenty of great restaurants in Las Vegas take themselves way too seriously. I loved Jaleo because while they serve excellent food they do it in a playful way. You're not going to find food served in sneakers (yes, I said SNEAKERS) at the new Gordon Ramsay Steak.  Located on the 2nd floor at the Cosmopolitan with a bunch of other restaurants (STK, China Poblano, etc.) the decor is modern Spanish with a mix of hightop, lowtop, and booth tables.  To order drinks you the waiter gives you an ipad to look up all their selections. The app was very easy to use and ended up being handy versus gimmicky. The Cuba Libre was one of the best  rum/coke  drinks I've ever had. With a cinnamon stick, bitters, and a giant sphere ice cube served in a red wine glass it was as beautiful as it was tasty. My date had the Jaleo bramble which because of the cucumber water and berry puree tasted very fresh.  On to the food!  Patatas Bravas (fried potatoes): A simple dish, but one of the best. Nicely fried with a delicious red sauce and aioli . These disappeared very quickly.  Gambas al Ajillo (shrimp with garlic sauce): The sauce on this dish rocked my world. Garlicky of course, but with a very deep flavor. We both wished for bread to get some more of the sauce.   Rape Donostiarra (monkfish with sherry): Very thinly sliced monkfish, which tastes similarly to lobster. Light sherry/olive oil sauce which was mild to let the taste of the fish through.  Mejillones Vapor (mussels with lemon and olive oil): Mussels were very little and the ones that weren't gritty tasted excellent. Sauce was very buttery, but went well with the mussels.  Setas al Ajillo (wild mushrooms): Hen of the woods mushrooms with a side of mashed potatoes. Really liked the potatoes, but the mushrooms tasted like mushrooms with nothing on them.  Overall a wonderful meal, made excellent with a few drinks and a beautiful date. It's a great first stop before heading out to Marquee!

Reviews.Author: Foodie -
Reviews.Content: Normally my friends and I don't settle for mediocre food, but it was 1 am on a Saturday night and we just needed a snack before continuing our girls night out at the Marquee.   tiny portions, kinda bland, and out of 7 dishes, we could hardly pinpoint any signature creations from that experience.   Think Disneyland prices with the same disneyland kinds of food quality.

Reviews.Author: Atm
Reviews.Content: i have eaten at the Jaleo in DC and LOVED it.  so i was excited to visit the Jaleo in Vegas.  i was disappointed to say the least.  the service was horrible...we had reservations and didn't get seated for almost 40 minutes.  and no one apologized even when we voiced our impatience.  the service continued to get bad.  we didn't see our waitress for almost 20 minutes and didn't get our water glasses filled for almost that long as well.  the server forgot to put our order in for the paella and it was at our table an hour after we ordered it.  and once it came to the table it was cold, overseasoned, and crunchy.  the couple next to us kept getting the wrong dishes from our server.  i would excuse the poor service if the food was out of this world.  everything was oversalted or overseasoned.  with the exception of the spinach salad which was completely bland.  i hope Jaleo gets with the program.  i am a big fan of Chef Andres' restaurants and i want to see him succeed.

Reviews.Author: Meagan
Reviews.Content: Caught an early dinner before a show at the Bellagio. My friend read about their happy hour tapas prices and this is why we went (that and she likes the chef/creator). We were told upon arriving that only D.C. Has that promo.  We decided to stay anyways. Misadvertisement = fail.    Service 4 stars  They offer you an iPad with a wine list to review, but it takes an offionado to know how to search the app. Wine is pricey, and though I was willing, the other couple was not willing to share a bottle over $75. Slim pickins at this point. Still they helped us find a bottle, even after my sending a few bottles back (unopened) because of the incorrectly listed vintages. (yes, I am that person.) The sommelier was kind, understanding, and helpful.   Food 4 stars The food was good, but not spectacular.   Value 2 We like to dine at high class 5star restaurants (perspective here), but didn't find the value of this place to match what we found. I am a regular visitor to Spain, and lived there for 7 mos years ago... Thus I wanted to love this place, but just didn't overall. I am super familiar with tapas style, but this place doesn't represent Spanish style dining well.   Would not return.

Reviews.Author: Fred
Reviews.Content: This is a place to fall in love with modern Spanish tapas.  It it's your first time, ask the waiter to suggest some of the signature dishes.  The veal cheeks, (I know, doesn't sound exactly good) are amazing.  Paella also.  Pricey, but worth it.

Reviews.Author: Kouroush
Reviews.Content: After winning a small jackpot at cosmopolitan we dedicated our prize to this amazing dinner experience on Christmas eve dinner. We had their bellota paella, patas brava, white asparagus, shrimp in garlic tomato sauce, and the lamb ribs. Everything was made to perfection and tasty. Our server was amazing and very helpful in helping us ordering and accommodated us with two of the best desserts I have ever had on the house because according to him some of our dishes took a bit longer to come out. Will definitely go back and try more dishes.

Reviews.Author: Yvonne
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying our server was great and the star rating has nothing to do with her, she gets 4 stars.   The double star, and I'm being nice, is for the horrid  Tapas  style food served at this make believe small plates Tapas restaurant. Let's just say if I wanted to eat boiled potatoes dripping in oil, well..I wouldn't. Last time I checked Patatas Bravas are fried ...but what do I know?    Yeah, it's busy...and swanky..but what isn't at the cosmopolitan? Save your money. Go somewhere else. Perhaps Capos...I'm sure they know how to make authentic italian.

Reviews.Author: Anna Lou
Reviews.Content: Why do I have to be on my diet coming here?! Unfortunately, my diet does not allow for paella, the dish that Jaleo boasts, but after having such a wonderful first experience, I know I'll definitely try it on my return. Food was excellent, tasty and creative.  Service was super fast, as in lightning fast! It seemed as if our orders came out within 5 minutes from ordering! At one time I asked for cream for my coffee and in what seemed like 2 seconds, suprise! The bus boy came right behind me with a little cup of cream! The menu, although shorter than Firefly's or Julian Serrano's, has masterfully crafted dishes.  My husband and I enjoyed every single dish we ordered. The wine list is well organized and well thought out.  Jaleo is the first restaurant that I have ever been to that uses Apple iPads as a menu -very unique and  trendsetty .  This is a promising restaurant and I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Author: Karl
Reviews.Content: Since I just had a bad experience at Julian Serrano's, I figured I'd better give a shout-out to the tapas place I wish I had gone to. We have eaten here twice (once as a couple and once in a group of 16, great service both times), and will again. I like the lively open kitchen atmosphere, excellent service and attention to detail. And the jamon Iberico- how can so much flavor be packed into molecule-thin slices. We experimented with how tiny a bit we could dissect out and still get the wow: almost invisible bits still sparking savory deliciousness.   Paella rotates depending upon the whim of the chef; two types are always available. This is a bit problematic, as we have missed the seafood paella 3 times, but it does allow proper preparation in a HUGE pan over an open fire by a dedicated paella preparer or two. Thus, whatever type they make is worthy.  We were seduced by the anytime availability of several types of paella at Julian Serrano, and learned that it's just not as good that way. There is a reason Jaleo does it the way they do, and it's worth it. So don't worry if your dream paella isn't on the menu, you may well discover a new dream.

Reviews.Author: Nilo
Reviews.Content: Salty Salty Salty.   I've been to Barcelona, Madrid and Valencia, and one thing you cannot go wrong in Spain is Tapas. I've been to the Jamon joints and couldnt believe how good the food was...  So hearing this place had tapas and had a renowned chef...me and my gf decided to go to this place and test it out. It was free meal on a Cosmopolitan invite, so we said why not.  First to start the wine was great, and spanish wine always gets me in the food mood. Second we placed our order for several tapas.  While in Spain we loved the Patatas Bravas...and boy we were excited... Wuah Wuah Wuah... not only was it a liberal version of Patatas Bravas - it was salty...and it was pretty much like Potatoe Chips covered in Bravas sauce. MAN How the F can you get this wrong...its a standard in any Spanish Tapas joint...  Well to say the least it went downhill from there. I felt like each tapas I ate I was eating a salt cube. Yeah it was that bad, so bad that when we left Vegas I felt like I was on a salt binge. Whats worse is that the Jamon that we had was supposed to be good...man the cheaper ones in Spain blew this piece of ham out of the water. Yes we bought some from Corte Ingles in Barcelona and brought them home and they were better than this $17 plate.  Well to say it...we won't be going back....sorry it just failed miserably.

Reviews.Author: Josie
Reviews.Content: Awesome! Go for the best iberico ham and manchego... It's worth it! Love the red sangria. Paella was delicious. My boyfriend is a big meat eater and he loved the paella. Quote:  This is vegetarian food that I would eat.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer
Reviews.Content: Service very good. Green Bean Salad was very overdressed and the Chicken and Mushroom Paella was so dry that I couldn't finish it. I should have known better than to order it knowing it wasn't made to order. Wine selection was good and the bartender seemed to know what he was talking about. If I ever came here again, I'd stick with the tapas style foods that are made to order.

Reviews.Author: Lik
Reviews.Content: Five stars for service, and four stars for the food. The food was a little salty, but if you have your meal with their fantastic gin and tonic, it would taste much less salty. Their four year aged ham is their best...must try!. Order what is recommended by Fodor's travel, they nailed it.

Reviews.Author: Emily
Reviews.Content: Amazing bachelorette party dinner.   The amazing waiter customized our menu to fit our $100/person budget. And boy we were thoroughly liquored and stuffed at the end! He suggested this fun way to drink our champagne called  porron  (sp). Lets just say we got WET and drunk!!  They started with lighter tapas and finished off with heavier dishes like carne asada, paella, and veal cheeks.   Couples dishes that were unforgettable:  Huevos frito con caviar (winner) Gambas al ajillo Manzanas con hinojo y queso Mancheg Veal cheeks carne asada

Reviews.Author: Sharon
Reviews.Content: Located inside the Cosmopolitan.  I can't remember everything we ordered, but here are some things to definitely try:  - the dates - the paellas - if you don't have preference of which one, just order whatever paellas is cooking in the middle of kitchen there - the salmon tartare - the taco cones - and definitely try the cured ham  The ambiance is very modern and fun.  Get a seat at the big cushion-couch and enjoy your party!

Reviews.Author: Jen
Reviews.Content: No. Just no. Unless you would like to have your entire weeks worth of sodium allowance in one bite of food, I would absolutely never ever recommend this establishment. We had a few things, all very disappointing. The sodium content overpowered the actual flavor of the food, and to top it off it wasn't cheap. So, in short I would not recommend eating here.

Reviews.Author: Andrea
Reviews.Content: 1st Time Ever trying  Liquid Olives ! That was the Highlight of my Experience. Our server, Mary was GREAT. I was fascinated by this dish and she explained the process of Spherification, even wrote it down for me and told me I could get my own kit online. This was by far the most unique item I have tasted in a long time. The Liquid Olives just melt in your mouth--- Thank you for your Fantastic Service Mary & Love the Flavorful Tapas at Jaleo.

Reviews.Author: Mel
Reviews.Content: I came here to celebrate my new job after ice skating at Cosmo and wasn't sure what to expect. It was the only place I could get a reservation at such short notice and nothing on the menu looked THAT amazing. It was also a little pricier than I wanted. While this sounds like the makings of a terrible review, I assure you, it was amazing. Our awesome server Janie was extremely helpful and friendly. She helped us pick out a few things- Croquetas De Pollo, Gambas Al Ajillo, and the Rossejat. They came out in that order and each dish just got better. While I wasn't crazy about the texture of the Rossejat, the flavor was great. My friend and I split the flan for dessert and it was possibly the best flan I've ever had. The sorbet that was served with it provided a great contrast of flavors and really complemented the dessert (as pretentious as that sounds, I can't find another way to describe it). I also had an Open Table check which took $20 off the bill and the manager actually knew what it was and didn't hassle me. Sweet!! One of the best dinners I've had in a while.

Reviews.Author: Jacqueline
Reviews.Content: Food and service was superb! I dined here with a group of three during Las Vegas Restaurant week. The menu included 9 tapas courses and we ordered two gin and tonics, as well as sangria, and a glass of wine.   The standout dishes were definitely the paella (which was vegetable, i can only imagine how amazing the seafood paella is!) the Melon con Jamon serrano (carved fresh!) and the sliders with Ibérico bacon.  The meal exceeded my expectations. I find sometimes when there is a special or pre-fixe menu the quality isn't as high, but this was definitely not the case. I have had tapas in Spain and this is the first restaurant in North America that the tapas has come to par with restaurants in Sevilla and Barcelona.  I have food allergies and our waiter was extremely attentive and separated my courses from the others in my group. He also suggested an amazing glass of wine to match the paella, and was extremely knowledgeable and more importantly nice.  Prices are a bit on the high side (our bill came to $270 for three including tip.) But the quality of food is totally worth it, I'll definitely be visiting again.

Reviews.Author: Cat
Reviews.Content: I love going to Jaleo for three reasons; the ambience, the whimsical food, and José's Gin and Tonics.  My favorites are, and it's hard to pick one,  lamb ribs served with a side of shaved salt and grilled scallions, veal cheeks served with puréed potatoes and morel mushrooms, monkfish drizzled in Spanish o.o., crab or tuna stuffed piquillo peppers, and of course the paella!  Although the menu often changes, you can always expect José to deliver a unique and exciting tapas experience!   Unfortunately, separate unsavory encounters with the waitstaff kept me from rating the restaurant four stars.  On another hand the bartenders and kitchen staff rock!

Reviews.Author: Sherry
Reviews.Content: Our dinner at Jaleo had hits and misses and all in all, it was quite mediocre.  I really enjoyed the paella that used short thin noodles instead of rice. It was very flavorful and filling. The sausage wrapped in thin potato slices and fried was disappointing - greasy and salty, but no depth to flavor at all. The smoked-cured ham was very good, especially with wine, since it was fatty. The steak was alright; nothing to write home about.  With the prices that Jaleo is charging, this is a pass unless you have a big group, then in which case, you'll have a great time, like the very loud and obnoxious table of rowdy women sitting 20ft away.

Reviews.Author: Joe
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were excited to try this place based on the menu. Unfortunately, it was probably one of the worst service I've received in a restaurant. The server did not look happy at all. We had four dishes and kid you not, they came out maybe 15-40 minutes apart. There was no joy eating there.   We weren't told until 20 minutes after we had ordered a dish that the computer was down and our orders didn't go through.   Another kicker- the group next to us came in after us, they ordered a lot more food and all their orders came before ours.

Reviews.Author: Claudia
Reviews.Content: i would highly recommend Jaleo if you enjoy the tapas as my friends and I do. First, the staff here is outstanding. They are knowledgable, fun, patient (we had a large group), and overall extremely professional. Next, the food is great with a menu ranging from what you would expect prepared extremely well to some unique offerings. Finally, the atmosphere is lively - fun and popping.

Reviews.Author: Michelle
Reviews.Content: I found this place to be pretty mediocre. I was with a group of 5.  Our waitress kept telling us that we EACH needed to order at least 5 tapas or we would be hungry.  Um...no.  We ordered about 12 total for the table and that was more than enough, but good for her to try and drive the bigger sale. The paella was the star, but everything else was just ok.  Had some tomato bread with serrano ham, the grilled shrimp, and oysters were decent.  The chicken fritters were gross and didn't care for the chorizo either. Service was only so-so - very aggressive waitress and slow drink service.

Reviews.Author: Brian
Reviews.Content: What a pleasant surprise! I've been to this place a couple of times years ago and I never thought that highly of the place. However, I came here the other night with my girlfriend on a date and I couldn't have been happier we did.  Place is very open speed and nicely decorated. Ambiance is very hip and casual. Nice place to grab drinks or a small bite before heading out for the night.   Service: This is where they really suffered. Within a span of 5 minutes, we had three different servers come over to go over the menu with us and ask our drink order. We were very confused because after the first server, we thought that was our server and gave her the drink order. So to have two more people come by showed they had no sense on anything about the tables. The crazy part was it continued throughout the night. I swear we had seven different servers!! The communication between them was terrible because they had no idea about what we ordered and our orders were all messed up! The dinner should have taken two hours tops - ended up being a three hour dinner as we sat there waiting for food we had ordered at start of the meal.  They comped our desserts and drinks because of the delay in the orders and mess ups - which was very nice of them.    Food: We ordered a ton of food! The food here is fantastic! Especially after just coming back from Barcelona, Spain. I appreciated the food so much more!  We ordered:  Sangria - good  Tomato Bread - Bomb  Ham, goat cheese, fig bread - Bomb!  Beet salad - Great!  Scallops - Delicious!   Shrimp - Awesome!  Dates - Bomb!  Seafood croquettes - Meh, not my favorite  Short Rib Paella - Great flavor - meat was on bone and not much of it. Hard to eat.   Lamb - small but great flavor  Steak - Really good!  The mousse dessert dish - So good!!   Food is fantastic! Small portions with high prices, but great flavor! Great scene! Service - poor. Overall great place

Reviews.Author: Aurora
Reviews.Content: Wonderful service and great food.  I had the Barrica wine to start off with and it was very smooth.  Our waiter suggested we share 3-4 tapas per person and that was probably too much for us.  3 tapas and a paellla would have been the perfect amount, but it was nice to try a little more.  We had (and I don't remember the tapas names) the huevitos with caviar, oysters Gin and Tonic, beet salad, chicken fritters, gambas ajillo, and chicken and mushroom paella.  I was looking forward to the lobster paella since it was so highly reviewed, but they only make 2 of the listed paellas a night and the lobster paella was not one of them.   It was a little loud, but it is located in The Cosmopolitan, which is a little loud for me in general.  But no complaints about the food and service.  We'll be back the next time we are in Vegas!

Reviews.Author: Rebecca
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed.  Probably not the best restaurant choice for lunch.  We were told by the server that they did not serve any meats, just the jamon iberico.  My niece and I both ordered sandwiches.  We were told that it would take 20 minutes because they made the bread from scratch.  My sandwich of manchego cheese and jamon iberico was okay, but I had better in Spain where I used to go at least twice a year.  My niece ordered the veggie sandwich, and all it had was a sliver of wilted lettuce (for $18!).  The service was non-attentive.  We figured because we did not order cocktails like the waiter was suggesting.  I was embarrassed because my niece was visiting from out-of-state, and I was the one who suggested Jaleo.  I thought I could try Jaleo first before joining some friends who were going to Bazaar Meat.  No, will not go any further on Jose Andres, sorry, and will not recommend to anyone!

Reviews.Author: Aaryn
Reviews.Content: I'm surprised at the low ratings here, as my husband and I found Jaleo to be delightfully delicious after ordering a decent sampling of different dishes.   We came in a little early, around 4:30 so the place wasn't hopping quite yet for dinner. After our flight and check-in to our hotel, and then getting over to the Cosmopolitan, (which is beautiful by the way) we were ready to eat. We used Open Table for our reservation, as we weren't sure what to expect. They're on the conference floor of the Cosmopolitan, and the restaurant is big and open. I wasn't expecting such an open and airy space. They had high tables in the main space, as well as a space off to the right with I believe a mix of lower and higher tables, as well as high bar seating, and then actual bar seating along the wall of the main space. At the back of the main space was a huge open kitchen with a fire pit where they make their paellas and that was so cool to watch.   We both ordered teas, although their drinks looked amazing. The menu is so big and comprehensive with big descriptions that it takes a little while to pick out a small handful of items to order, especially if  you're trying to coordinate with another person. Our waitress, Morgan, was more than accommodating as we read our novel menus and picked out our tapas. We decided on the following:   Lomo Bellota: We started with the Smoke-cured, acorn-fed pork loin. It was thinly sliced, nicely presented and had a lot of great flavors, we enjoyed it.   Gambas al Ajillo: This was my husband's choice - shrimp in a garlic sauce. It was actually a tomato garlic sauce, and came with a cute, miniature piece of baguette, he liked it.  Paella de Pollo: The chicken and wild mushroom paella was by far our favorite dish of the evening. While filling, and a decent portion, we ate the whole thing. It was flavorful, buttery, and just incredible. The best thing we had, hands down.   Piquillos Tolosa: These were thinly sliced red peppers with sauce - they were fantastic. Soft, yet firm enough to pick up with a fork. They weren't spicy at all, and had a subtle sweet flavor. These were our second favorite of all that we ordered.  Coliflor: This was roasted cauliflower with green olives and dates. We weren't crazy about this dish, and felt it was an odd combination. The sweet with the cauliflower and the tang of the olives was a little too bizarre for us.  Atun con Ajonjol: My husband ended with the sesame crusted seared tuna and said that the tuna was over seared and tasted a little old, but over all the dish was ok.  I'm giving Jaleo four stars. We really liked the tapas experience and the restaurant was clean and pretty. Our waitress was super attentive and really nice, and took the time to explain everything to us. The paella is worth two stars on its own, we loved it so much. I'm leaving off that last star due to the Coliflor and the Atun con Ajonjol that could have been better, and we felt that everything was a little pricey. Otherwise though, this was a stellar experience that has us thinking about doing tapas again. Thanks!

Reviews.Author: Debra
Reviews.Content: Probably some of the best food I've eaten ever. Seriously. There were 4 of us and we indulged by ordering probably close to 20 different tapas dishes. The bill was outrageous but worth every penny.   A few highlights:  - The croquettes were served in a sneaker. Yes, a running sneaker. Not sure why, but it was cool all the same. - This place is in the Cosmopolitan which is a hip hotel in Vegas. This place may be trying to be a little too hip. It was too bright and felt like it was in the middle of a mall. You could see everyone walking by outside. Granted, it's in a Las Vegas hotel/casino so we knew there'd be some level of loud excitement surrounding us, just not so much.  -   Service was good, but odd. We never really knew who our waiter was. It kept changing.  - We did not eat one bad dish. Some were better than others, but none were bad. - Bread was hard to come by. Tapas often had incredibly delicious sauces (the  mojo  for example) and it's a shame to waste that sauce. We asked for bread to dip and got 3 little tiny pieces (for $3). It was not enough bread, at all. We ordered a few more of them. This did not spoil our appetite one bit.   A few of my favorite tapas:  - Grilled asparagus with Romesco sauce - the Romesco was incredible - Croquettas de pollo (my Cuban mother-in-law makes really good croquettes but these blew hers away!) Creamy inside, crunchy outside, so much flavor   - Papas arugas - The mojo made this dish! Without it, this is basically just salted, boiled tiny potatoes.  Thanks to a duo of mojo's (verde and rojo) this dish delicious - Warm Brussels sprouts salad - this had a really nice citrus flavor to it and was like no flavor combination I've ever had with Brussels sprouts before  - Fried dates in bacon with an apple mustard sauce - like candy. Seriously.  - Seared scallop with pine nuts - melt in your mouth good  - Mussels vinaigrette - plump and juicy mussels with aromatic broth - another reason we needed all that bread!  - Grilled hangar steak with mustard sauce and blue cheese - incredibly tender and great combination of flavors  - Shrimp sautéed with garlic - it's a traditional tapas dish but it tasted better than any other version of this I've had before  - Oysters gin & tonic - I can't eat raw oysters for a few more months but my tablemates raved about the gin & tonic sauce   Just ok:  - Pan con tomate with manchego cheese. Not bad at all, just not earth shattering  - Jamon Iberico - it was from some fancy black footed pig in Spain. It wasn't bad but it wasn't all that great either. It was the most expensive thing we ordered that night   - Homemade grilled pork sausage - I'm not a huge sausage fan in general (get your mind out of the gutter, THAT's not what I mean). This was not bad at all but just not one of my favorites    I know there was more but this is all I can remember. We had no room for dessert. The 3 folks at the table who aren't pregnant polished off several carafes of Sangria and seemed very please with it, and with themselves.  We finished with coffee and each one came in it's own little press (Spanish press, not French I guess) and a timer to tell you when to  press . The concept was great but servers came over and pressed for us before the time was up. We were all disappointed that we didn't get to press our own. Silly for us to care, I know - but why bother giving you a timer and telling you what to do if they're just going to do it for you!  Damn good coffee though - even my  decaf (booo) had nice flavor.

Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: Great service and excellent food. We had our server pick out the entire meal and he did a fantastic job. We started with endives with mandarin almonds and something else I can't remember. We had croquettes serve in a shoe...they were amazing but the show was weird...apparently the chef trying to be cute....but kind of tacky but I guess that flys here in sin city.  We also got shrimp, steak and bruschetta which were all equally amazing but our favorite was the carne asada steak. The dessert was the French toast and was awesome. I would recommend jaleo to even my most picky foodie friends . Again the service was so good it rivaled the best in NYC.

Reviews.Author: Nick
Reviews.Content: Simply amazing experience. The food is top notch, the staff even more so. Pretty much tried as much as we could, and enjoed it all with a bottle of wine...everything kept getting better each course. Dont be an impatiant, whiney, jackass, sit back, soak up where you are, and try some perfectly executed food.

Reviews.Author: Beth
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews I was hesitant to stop for lunch.  We had been to e' and Bazaar in Miami Beach several times and knew the outstanding quality and flavors of a Jose Andrés restaurant so could Jaleo REALLY be a 3+ star restaurant?  The answer is absolutely not UNLESS you compare it to e' - which, of course is totally unfair since e' is 7 to 8 times the cost and number of courses as Jaleo.  Pleasantly surprising Jaleo did share a couple of dishes from Bazaar (endive with citrus and chevre and gazpacho ).  The shrimp in olive oil with chilies and ginger and the hangar steak were outstanding.  By far the best tasting option in Vegas at an amazing price.

Reviews.Author: Robert
Reviews.Content: Took my 2 sisters and wife here for my big sisters bday. Ambience and service were great. Food not so much. Few of the cooks must have been heavy handed on the salt that night. Everything was too salty and I like salt. Probably going to give it another try though. Egg and onion omelet with uni was my fav dish.  Sangria and cocktails were really good.

Reviews.Author: TH
Reviews.Content: Terrific tapas. Had a dozen little things to try and they all within range from good to excellent. The umami in the olive oil ice cream with grapefruit ice and candied rind segments was unexpected and extremely memorable. Their Best Gin and Tonic is, yes, the best gin and tonic. Fresh kaffir lime leaf, juniper berries, lemon zest with an ice sphere made for an excellent aperitif. I hope the next time I come, I get the same experience with the food.  I don't know what people expect with the ambiance and why they bomb it. Its not fine dining or white table cloth service--it should be loud. You should hear the fire roar on the grill to your left, the commis in the open raw bar confirming orders with urgency, plates and glasses banging and inebriated douche bags yelling for more Tempranillo. Its the experience! ITS a little part of  SPAIN pocketed in a little part of VEGAS. Enjoy it while it lasts. Nothing rarely does anymore.

Reviews.Author: Kerry
Reviews.Content: Went last night. Was worried that wouldn't be enough food from all the reviews. We did the tasting menu which was 55/pp. It was great. Got to try 10 dishes each and included dessert. Was plenty of food ! Highlights were paella,chicken fritters and tomato bread. Dessert was delicious. Service was very good! Definitely would go back. The setting is very hip and pretty casual.

Reviews.Author: Amy
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for something lively, light, and trendy, give Jaleo a try.  It is located in the Cosmopolitan Hotel and Casino on the Strip in Vegas.   The level with the restaraunts is all open to a common area with so it has an open feel.  It is rather load and a lot of movement between wait staff and servers, etc.  Tapas menu with prices ranging from $9 - $22 per plate.  We went for a light snack - ordered only 2 tapas but they accidently brought us a 3rd one:   They waitress recommended about 3 tapas per person.  We only went with one since we had a very late lunch that day and really didn't want a full dinner.  Items sampled: Huevo frito con caviar - A fried organic egg topped with caviar over carmelized onion  $16 - which they slice and mix up at table) - it was served with crouton like toast.... I wouldn't have ordered it and the flavors were pretty mild.) We also had the Ostra Gin and tonic - Six oysters with lemon, gin and tonic $12 and the Vieiras con salsa de romesco (Seared scallops with romesco sauce) $10 -both of these items were tasty but nothing to go gaga over.  There is a private group room but other than than, would not say it's great for a big group due to the noise and you are seated really tight..

Reviews.Author: Jessica
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure what's up with the poor reviews but my friends and I had an awesome Tapas' dinner here on 11/12/11.   The restaurant was packed and everyone seemed to be enjoying themselves as we were. It was loud, in fact there was a party of four next to us drinking sangria and getting pretty tipsy but we enjoyed it. It was fun and festive and there was plenty of people watching right there.     Our waiter was fantastic and he recommended lots of wonderful dishes.   We had... Bacon Wrapped Dates Flat Bread with Serrano Ham Endive with Goat Cheese, Almonds and Orange Prawns with Red Chiles  Lobster Paella Flan*** DO NOT MISS THE FLAN  Olive Oil Ice Cream  My husband's favorite was the flat bread with the Serrano ham, my friends was the endive with goat cheese almonds and orange and mine was the flan and the olive oil ice cream.   We are all familiar with Spanish food and therefore knew that the portions are on the smaller side and meant to be shared.   We all came away extremely happy and looking forward to going again when we are next in Vegas.  If you are looking for a heavy meal that makes you want to sleep for a year, don't go here. This is the perfect place to start out a night on the town.

Reviews.Author: Elvis
Reviews.Content: Truly awful.  To begin with the noise level in the place is uncomfortably loud, and the booth tables and benches are hard wood with no cushions.   We ordered a bottle of wine based on the waiter's recommendation as something light that would go with all of the food choices.  Nope.  It was heavy like a cabernet, not light like a pinot noit.  It was downhill from there.    We started with some cheese and breads which were okay but terribly over priced.  Next was the white asparagus which came out soggy and tasteless.  It was like eating baby food it was so mushy.  We ordered some ham which was okay but it had no condiments with it so it was unappealing.  Ordered the shrimp and calamari paella (took 30 minutes to prepare) and the shrimp arrived undercooked/almost raw.  We could not eat it and asked to speak to the manager about the quality of the food that evening. He apologized and didn't charge us for the paella because it wasn't edible, which was the right thing to do.    This was the worst meal we've ever had in Las Vegas, and also one of the worst we've had anywhere in a very long time.  This place is over-hyped and overpriced.  Go to Bar Masa if you want a fabulous meal with small plate choices.

Reviews.Author: Alia
Reviews.Content: Fun and Adventurous! (and Expensive... but then all strip restaurants are)  This is more like a 3.5 star place. The service is fantastic but the noise level is a bit too  energetic ... (aka Loud) so it makes having a conversation a bit hard.  If you can .... and have a group... reserve the private room... it's much more intimate and quieter in there.  We enjoyed a number of Interesting plates.  The white asparagus was quite lovely.... and light.  It was a good veggie starter.  The caviar and egg dish was very good.... rich.... but the caviar is not as rich as one would expect for this dish.  The cold garlic soup was different.... good... but different... the grapes off set the garlic part which is a good contrast.  The spinach was Very Good.... it had bacon and raisins in it... I know... raisins?  Yup... raisins.... loved it.   But then bacon makes everything taste better.... so the raisins were a nice counter balace to the salty.  The veal cheek was also good but not off the charts good like I was hoping.  I wanted melt in your mouth, eye popping good and it wasn't.  The  pigs in a blanket  .... sausage wrapped in a potato chip were good .... but not spectacular.  It was like a little weenie rolled in a potato chip.    The empanada was more like a won ton filled with fishy cream.  Not what I expected at all.... we ate it because it wasn't horrible... but it wasn't all that good either.  Our favorite was the piquillo stuffed with crabmeat.... good flavor and texture. The crab was a contrast yet a complement to the piquillo.  For dessert, we had the Chocolate Flan... it was quite good.  Creamy not overly sweet nor overly rich.  It was a smooth, milky chocolate.  :)

Reviews.Author: Rebecca
Reviews.Content: The food here is wonderful!  I came here for my birthday and was blown away at the quality of the service and food. The service was impeccable. Our server was polite and friendly and offered great feedback on the dishes. The bussers, or just other staff there were always on top of it. Anytime my water glass needed refilling or my wine was running low it would be filled, dirty dishes never stayed on our table for very long. Top notch service.   The food was incredible. We got the 13-course tasting menu. From start to finish I was blown away by all but one dish. The carne asada is to die for and the chocolate cake served at the end was so god I didn't want it to end. I originally when there because I saw they served paella, which is one of my favorite dishes. We were served a paella as part of our menu, but it was pretty bland and a little mushy. I was seriously disappointed in it; but the rest of the food made up for it. Now I know to not order paella there.  Oh, and do yourself a favor and get the pitch of sangria. It's totally worth it.

Reviews.Author: Dyanna
Reviews.Content: Jaleo, you pleasantly surprised me. Although I can never accept the fact of paying $14 for a small chicken breast is justifiable here. I still have to admit, the food was freakin' spectacular! And there was entertainment, and people watching, and flames! Every time a Paella was ordered they rang a bell and yelled out PAELLA!!!!!!!  Between my boyfriend and I, we shared about 7 small plates, and I probably could have added 3 or 4 more, but I knew our bill was already at about $150 with our $5 sprites and $6 shirley temples. I had to try it when they said it was  homemade grenadine . Good, but not $6 good.  On the menu, all of the dishes are in Spanish and some are a bit confusing, but the staff is super helpful and knowledgeable. A couple that stood out to me were the stuffed roasted red peppers with goat cheese, the garlic shrimp, and the chicken croquettes served in a shoe. There was not anything I tried, that I would not eat again. My only complaint is the prices. $20 for 2 scallops? I get it. Were at the Cosmo, it's a Jose Andres restaurant, but I want to come here and be able to drop $100 including a tip and have my other half and I leave stuffed. That will never happen.  So yes, it is good, yes you will enjoy yourself. It is simply a matter of opinion if it's worth it to you. To me, places like this should have locals specials, or a local night. At the same time, maybe they don't want to cater to us locals. They have enough going for them to live off tourism.  I will return, but only on a special occasion or at the request of a Paella.

Reviews.Author: Jackie
Reviews.Content: One word: salty! The dishes seemed to get saltier and less edible as the meal went on. Generally the ambience is good - festive, well-decorated, signature cocktails and wines with tapas. The menu was bright and cheery and drinks are ordered by iPad. We'd had a massive brunch earlier in the day and so weren't starving, but did split a variety of vegetarian dishes. I noticed the non-vegetarian dishes seemed to be plated quite creatively (one served in a shoe, another served as little cones).  - Pan de cristal con tomate fresco - This was probably our favorite dish. Crusty white bread with a smattering of tomato and olive oil. The tomato was more flavored into the bread, rather than a hunk of tomato sitting on top of it. Good flavor and definitely not too salted.  - Setas en escabeche - These mushrooms were fine. Nothing to write home about. A bit on the saltier end, without enough other flavor.  - Coliflor con olivas y frutos secos - A dish that is usually one of our favorites. Nothing special about it. It was on the more edible side, but again, had too much salt. The over-salting even offset the nice flavor of the fruit.  - Espinacas a la catalana - We have a favorite tapas restaurant in San Francisco that makes this beautifully (Alegrias). Whenever I see this on a menu I think it'll be served like theirs - sautéed to perfection with raisins and pine nuts. This felt like a spinach salad with salt poured on. The spinach was not well-sauteed at all.  - For our last dish, we thought we'd ordered a combo of sautéed eggplant and onion. We got served some mix of what I believe was eggplant and a lot of cheese. Again, not in love with it.  While I didn't love a lot of the food, I did appreciate that there were many vegetarian items on this tapas menu. Generally, it was fairly reasonably priced compared to many other places in Vegas.

Reviews.Author: Mindy
Reviews.Content: I totally adore this place. The food is all inventive and every single dish we got there was delicious. I especially love the Secreto. The cocktails were all so creative and delicious. The environment is laid-back and not too formal.

Reviews.Author: Jenny
Reviews.Content: Loved this place! Great ambiance, great drinks and food. We had a party of six all with different dietary restrictions and preferences and each waiter and runner were on point with that info, explained each dish and impressed us.   Go there!!

Reviews.Author: D
Reviews.Content: Our dinner party wanted to indulge in a great dinner meal for the evening.  Our VIP host was able to book us a six person table-top amidst a booked and busy Saturday night.  She introduced us to the Executive chef (not Jose Andres) and asked that he present his recommended plates / menu for the evening.  Before I dive into the food, I'll speak of the restaurant itself.  Jaleo is located on the third floor of the Cosmopolitan hotel.  It's a restaurant that faces and opens up to Cosmo's restaurant collection (including Scarpetta, STK, Milos, D.O.C.G., etc.).  The energy on the third floor is always buzzing with a plethora of night-goers preparing for a long evening.  The energy at Jaleo is no different.  In fact, you are immersed with the crowd given that half of the restaurant is completely open.  I personally loved the high energy.  However, go elsewhere if you are looking for an intimate dinner.  The food itself... not memorable.  In fact, I don't recall any of the names of the items we had. While the presentation of the dishes were creative and beautiful in design, the flavors and taste were nothing out of the ordinary.  Given the prices, I expected much more.  I wanted to be wowed with big bold flavors and an experience much different than your normal tapas affair.  Unfortunately it wasn't.  I've had better dishes for half the price and unfortunately my review reflects that.

Reviews.Author: Jon
Reviews.Content: Looking for something different, this is the place, positively!! Great waitstaff. Explained menu items without any hesitation. Try the Brazilian Tan for a cocktail, authentic, delicious! Tapas selection is diverse, and sometimes need explaining.  Will be back.

Reviews.Author: Tony
Reviews.Content: The food was only average for a place that should be 4 stars or better. The real bummer was the level of service. The waitress not only forgot to order some of our food, when she finally did, she got it wrong. The portions were small and only mildly tasty.   I love Tapas restaurants and I really liked the Cosmopolitan Hotel but I will never go here again. T  The best part was the place was so busy, we couldn't get in without a reservation the night before! We should have just passed all together!

Reviews.Author: Jared
Reviews.Content: Food and alcohol deserve 4 stars - very standard classic spanish/basque tapas executed well, very creative and delicious specialty cocktails.  Ambiance and service deserve 0 stars - overly loud dining room, unnecessarily lazy staff and servers.  For the details -   Firstly, Jaleo messed up my reservation.  I originally had a res for a party of 6 people @ 6PM on Friday.  I called 3 days prior to change to 8 people @ 7 PM.  I didn't get a confirmation call the day-of which I thought was weird.  Sure enough, they never changed the original reservation and since we were  an hour late  when we arrived, they had already given up our table.  They did seat us immediately but had to squeeze us into a table meant for 6 right at the front of the restaurant by the bar and hotel escalators.  Yuck.  And, as noted by many here, the main dining room is certainly loud.  I also think it's ridiculous that they don't answer their phones before dining service begins.  Having to wait til 8PM on the east coast to call and make (and then change) reservations was ludicrous.  This is probably also why they don't call you to confirm.  So, we were seated and the waitress came around to take drink orders and informed us that, in her exact words,  the kitchen is broken  and they were doing all the cooking on the grills in the middle of the restaurant, so there were a few dishes that weren't available.  She didn't specifically mention which, of course.  We got our drinks and they were all amazing.  The famous G&T, sangria, some gold sparkly drink, a drink with instructions on how to drink it (dip this into this, then put this in your mouth, then sip this, then do a dance...)  Now, I'm a tapas whore, and the menu at Jaleo is very much standard classic tapas, nothing really out of the ordinary.  So I go to order 6 of the usual suspects for my wife and I.  They couldn't make a single one of them.  Well, what can you make then?   Well nothing from this side of the menu or that side of the menu.   So...let me try again...what CAN you make?  Wound up figuring things out and placing our order, and the tapas started arriving shortly thereafter.  Except the runners kept coming to my side of the long table, saying to me what the dish was, and then putting it down in front of me.  So I had to turn into the waiter, loudly screaming across the table to see who ordered each dish and then passing it down.  I finally got fed up around the 8th plate or so and started forcing the runners to do their job and figure out who ordered each dish so they could place it in front of the right person.  For.every.single.dish.  Ugh.  Also, there were a few dishes we had ordered doubles of that we never received.    Thank god the food was good.  We probably ordered every dish that was available and none disappointed.  Winner of the night in my book was the lamb ribs.  Fall-off-the-bone delicious.  Other mentionables - patatas bravas were potato chips which was a neat twist, and the romesco sauce had an interesting smokey flavor.  Otherwise, as I said, pretty standard stuff all executed well.

Reviews.Author: jerry
Reviews.Content: Was in Vegas over the Thanksgiving weekend and stopped in with some family friends.  First impression, elegant without being snobby.  A pretty casual atmosphere within an upscale feeling.  On to the food, we started with a charcuterie plate that included delicious ham from Spain along with some other cold cuts.  We paired that with a cheese plate that had some goat cheese (dont knock it till you try it) along with some bleu cheese and fruit, absolutely delicious!    We ventured out into the rest of the menu, we tried the calamari stuffed with pork (awesome), the grilled octopus, some small (tapas people) cones stuffed with raw salmon & roe and raw tuna along with other ingredients I cant recall, the cauliflower, brussel sprouts, and a spanish egg/potato pancake of sorts (also awesome) then the potato with mushrooms.......you get the picture we tried almost everything but the paella.  You can order what ever paella they have that day (our choices were veggy or chx/mushroom) or you can choose from 8 types but must order a whole pan (feeds 8)  Our server was attentive, very knowledgeable on the menu and friendly.  Only small knock was pricing, but given that its Vegas and were in a casino I guess its all relative.  All and all, it was a very pleasurable dining experience and would recommend anyone to go there.  I know I will go again when I'm back.

Reviews.Author: Andre
Reviews.Content: Delicious, delicious, delicious. Only negative was that some dishes took a little while to get to the table. But when they got there...my word and stars! Bacon wrapped dates and the spicy chorizo were the highlights.

Reviews.Author: Celine
Reviews.Content: First impressions are a lasting impression! I actually didn't know Jose Andres had a restaurant at Cosmo, and when I passed by it during the day, I was so excited I made a reservation on the spot for later that night. The ambience and decor was awesome! Colorful and very spanish, definitely reminded me of Spain. One of the tables even had foosball under that you could play with. now that was... awesome.  We were seated promptly, and because it was a monday after EDC weekend, a lot of items on the menu were not available. It was saddening.. we were so hungry and all of the popular dishes were gone :( Anyways, we ordered:  -Croquetas De Pollo- I love this dish at bazaar! Had to get it here, it was just as yummy but a little bit more salty.. It comes served in a shoe. When I asked the server why, she explained it was the brand Spanish Camper- the oldest shoe brand in Spain from a small village. Jose Andre wanted to support their company, so he created this  food on the run .. haha -Jamon serrano Fermin- delicious! Came with little bread sticks and it was so so good. -Ensaladilla rusa- ultimate spanish tapa: a salad of potatoes, mayo, and imported conserved tuna with spanish trout roe- after mixing it together, it was very rich and flavorful. Yum. -La Serena con membrillo- La Serena cheese, walnut dust, and quince paste cone- wasn't a big fan of this, the cheese was overpowering, usually love Jose Andres' cones but not this one. -Ostras Gin and Tonic- oysters with lemon, gin and tonic. So refreshing and light! These oysters were small and sweet- loved it! although we both had a slight allergic reaction to these oysters. -Paella valenciana rafael vidal- couldn't leave here without trying a paella! only paella they had left.. it had chicken, rabbit, and green beans, and was absolutely yummy. We finished every last piece of rice haha.  Overall extremely yummy meal. Our server was very gracious and recommended and explained the dishes very well. She was like a Jose Andres dictionary- she really knew her information on the dishes and what was on it.   The six dishes left us feeling satisfied for two- not too full and not too hungry. Total was about $120 without tip and we ordered a drink. I saw some reviews complaining about the prices and small portions, but hey- its Vegas. Also, Jose Andres' prices and portions are always consistent- Bazaar is similar to Jaleo in terms of that. This place isnt as good as Bazaar in LA (that place has a special place in my heart) but if I am back in Vegas, I would definitely come back and eat here!

Reviews.Author: Vincent
Reviews.Content: Having been to The Bazaar by Jose Andres and loved it, I was excited to try some of his more traditional fare.  Overall, I thought this meal was fun and an overall success.  We came here on a Sunday night without reservations but were seated right away as a table had just become available.  This is off to a good start!  We started with the Aceitunas ($12 for 4 anchovy stuffed green olives and 4 kalamata olive spheres made from sodium alginate).  I've had Jose's black olive spheres at the Bazaar and actually thought the kalamatas work much better.  Next, we had the Chistorra Envuelta ($8 for 6 skewers).  The spicy chorizo  was quite tasty and contrasted perfectly with the crunchiness of the potato chip wrapped around the  skewer.  The waitress highly recommended the Gambas al Ajillo ($10 for 6 shrimps) which the menu features as one of their most popular dishes.  Maybe it was high expectation from the waitress and the menu, but I thought the shrimp wasn't really anything special.  Sure it was perfectly cooked, but it just tasted like nicely cooked shrimp with garlic oil.  My favorite dish of the night was easily the Pinchon Estilo Alcantara which was squab topped with foie gras and shaved black truffle ($22).  All the flavors came together so well.. I would have ordered this plate just for myself.. who says sharing is caring?  The Rape a la Donostiarra ($10 for a large platter of thinly sliced monkfish) was pretty solid.  The waitress said it was a brave dish.. I've never had monkfish prepared this way before, but didn't think it was anything overly eccentric.  Finally, we had the Arroz a Banda con Bogavante ($28) which is their lobster paella.  I was really looking forward to this, since we were sitting right next to the paella station.  As a quick note, they only serve 2 paellas at any given night, and could take up to 30 minutes to prepare, so be aware that not all options are going to be available.  The paella was quite rich and tasty.. a tad over-seasoned, but that's ok.  Each dish is served with half a lobster tail and a claw, which was a nice touch.  We had our meal with a pitcher of red sangria, which I highly recommend.  You can never really go wrong with wine mixed with fruit.  Overall, Jaleo was pretty much what I expected from Jose Andres - tasty, modern Spanish cuisine.  I can't wait to come back to try everything else on the menu.  Definitely come in a group to maximize the selection.  I thought our party of 6 was perfect, since most of the dishes come in groups of 6.  Also, I actually thought the price was fairly reasonable for what we were getting.  4 stars!!

Reviews.Author: Scott
Reviews.Content: Ate here Friday night.  Good scene but everything else just ok, including service.

Reviews.Author: Tamar
Reviews.Content: The fried dates appetizer alone will get me back here. I am in love with the Jaleo Bramble signature drink (I had 3 or 4). Also, the flan with the orange sorbet is out of this world. Besides the fact that they gave away our table for 8 (then made us wait 30+ min for a table I had reserved over a month in advance) after I asked them to hold it for 10 minutes while we got our wrists stamped for Marquee Nightclub upstairs, we had a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Author: Nick
Reviews.Content: It's safe to say that this is the best tapas restaurant I have been to. While the quail was nothing special, the almond and garlic cold soup was superb. If you are in Vegas, be sure to go here. The setting is hip and trendy and the menu is packed with good choices. I didn't try the g&t but it claimed to be great. It's above the chandelier bar in the Cosmopolitan. Be sure to stop by for a great meal in Vegas.

Reviews.Author: Gina
Reviews.Content: 4 stars for their food... otherwise it'd be 2 for service.  Came here with a large group and were seated  outside  (but not really outside).  We ordered many apps to share, such as the fritters served in a shoe (yup), warm endive with goat cheese and pine nuts (something like that... maybe I'm just making it up), warm brussel sprout salad, salmon carpaccio (yum), fried egg topped with caviar (boring, actually, and there was too much egg to caviar ratio that the caviar got lost), and my favorite... the uni toast... omg!  Smokey flavor galore.  Make sure you order that!  Now for service: I asked him for his preference between the salmon carpaccio and the salmon/ikura tartare cones.  He salad he preferred the tartare, but I still went with the carpaccio.  He then proceeds to argue with me saying that the carpaccio vinaigrette overpowers the salmon.  Even after I told him I appreciated his suggestion, he kept going and going and going, almost offended that I went with the opposite.  Chill out, you're not the one eating it.  And guess what, the vinaigrette was not overpowering at all, in my opinion.

Reviews.Author: Brian
Reviews.Content: Yay, the $25  eat lunch like a Spaniard  3-tapas deal. For bigger and hungrier Spaniards there is a $30 4-tapas deal. I really was craving paella from the very impressive open fire stove, but with four of us there was a great opportunity to try many different tapas dishes.  Favorites included the octopus (some of the best to ever pass my lips), Apple & fennel salad, bacon wrapped dates, pat stars bravado, and the chicken. The sausage tapas are really good as were the  shoes . Take a look at other folks pictures to see what's in those shoes!  Only dish not enjoyed so much was the hanger steak. Perfectly cooked and beautifully presented but a bit on the tough side and tended to stick between the teeth. Good flavor though.  Excellent service was rendered by server Gary and the rest of the team.   Will I return.... In a heartbeat!

Reviews.Author: Jennster
Reviews.Content: I was so excited to have my first tapas meal.  We had a reservation and were seated quickly.  Its a lovely and lively atmosphere.    Our initial order consisted of toasted bread brushed with tomato (Pan de cristal con tomate), ham (Lomo ibérico de bellota Fermín), cheese (Rey Silo Rojo con albaricoques y almendras) and shrimp and lobster (Croquettas de mariscos).  All of these were fine, however from here things went downhill.    We ordered a paella and a carnes (Paella de pollo y setas silvestres and Chorizo casero con puré de patatas al aceite de oliva).  Both of these items we so incredibly salty they were inedible.  They were horrible.  I expected the ham plate we had earlier in our meal to be salty, but it was nothing compared to the paella and chorizo.  Our server asked if there was anything wrong and we stated that the items were too salty.  She took the items away and asked what else we would like.  We asked for the check.  My mouth was ruined from the extreme saltiness.  Imagine my surprise when the check came and the two items we didn't eat were still on the bill!  At this point, my husband just wanted to leave, so he paid cash and we left.    I left with a bad taste in my mouth, literally and figuratively.  Also, left hungry despite paying $140+ for the meal and drinks and tip.

Reviews.Author: L
Reviews.Content: We made sure to make a reservation on a Saturday night to dine here.  We arrived before our reservation and were asked to wait.  It is oneof those places where unfortunately, you feel that if you are not within close proximity to the host staff while waiting for your reservation they will conveniently overlook you and handle the people who are in their face, even though you have a reservation.  We are finally seated next to a long table that looks like a bachelor party of men in their 30s. This table distracted our server throughout our time there.  The wine and drinks lists on the IPad is  cutting edge , yet not all kinks with this have been worked out. We ordered a bunch of different small plates.  Friends enjoyed the cold almond and garlic soup.  The paella was just ok.  The lobster salad had some zing.  Egg with caviar was rich with good flavor. This is a trendy spot with potential to be a lasting restaurant with improvements in service.

Reviews.Author: Nancy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I ate here on our last day in Vegas for his birthday.  My husband was born and raised in Spain so he is very familiar with tapas style food.  Unfortunately, undercooked, sliders which contained pork were raw, pink and mushy when we sliced into it. The rest of our meal was delicious, especially the croquettes.  Unfortunately, my husband had already eaten 1/2 the slider before we realized it was raw and had later had stomach problems which kept us indoors for a few hours on our lasday in Vegas---:( really disappointing.  The waiter was really kind and professional and the ambiance was nice.  We would not return though, as raw meat with pork in it can definitely get you sick and in this case it unfortunately did.

Reviews.Author: Nathan
Reviews.Content: I rarely write yelp reviews but feel that my review may be helpful here. I'm shocked that this restaurant is getting a 3.5 yelp average (which typically means a mediocre restaurant), as I just had one of the best meals of my life here and for a price that was incredibly reasonable. I eat out a VERY nice meal almost every week for work travel and compare this restaurant to that set. The dishes at Jaleo were creative with astonishing and successful combinations of flavors and ingredients.  I had:  1. Beet salad (best I've ever had by far) 2. Wild mushrooms with potato puree (delicious) 3. Shrimp sautéed in garlic (plate-licking good) 4. Spinach with pine nuts, raisins, and apples (simple but loved it) 5. For desert, flan (a masterpiece, sensational)  Also had a nice glass of wine and coffee. I was stuffed and the pre-tip bill was only $65, which I considered a bargain given the amount of food and the quality.  A sense of the creativity-- the beet salad was served with beets three ways (raw, boiled, & fried). Any of these 5 dishes, I would have raved about at another restaurant. To get 5 such dishes in one meal blew me away! I can't wait to go back.  Other comments/suggestions: The restaurant is busy and a bit clubby in feel, so it's loud though it may vary somewhat depending where you sit. The food comes out when ready, so if you want to stage your meal (e.g., appetizers then main), order in stages, not all at once. With such a large selection, it can help to ask for the waiter's favorites and the most popular dishes across the menu.  This absolutely deserves a 4.5 rating on yelp; I've yet to go to any restaurant that I felt deserved a 5.   Overall - loved it, highly recommend it, and wish they'd open one in LA!

Reviews.Author: Marissa
Reviews.Content: Liquid Olives!  It's an Experience and worth trying. 1 crazy science experiment of liquidy olive oil with a thick gel coating. If I knew you could play with food as a science experiment I might have actually cared about my science fair as a kid.   All in all one of the best meals I've had on the strip! This place in known for its gin and tonic but it's the food that won me over!  The ham plate is Devine! Super thin slices with pine nuts and a delicious sauce. The goat cheese great beans were absolutely phenomenal! I could quite possibly eat them for breakfast, lunch and dinner!   They also have a great selection of wine and other cocktails.

Reviews.Author: Tigran
Reviews.Content: Love all of José Andres' restaurants but Jaleo is the only place to get your authentic Paella. Made fresh every 30 or so minutes. Chicken croquettes are a must eat too! Always busy around dinner time.

Reviews.Author: Vu
Reviews.Content: I swore off Jose Andres establishments after our disastrous experience in Miami, but my wife and brother talked me into it.  I am glad they did because the meal awesome.    Surprisingly Jaleo was the best meal of our trip.   Every dish the server brought out was great.  Service was spotty at times, but the awesome food made up for it!   Go here for your pre-Marquee meal.

Reviews.Author: Melanie
Reviews.Content: Oh Jose Andres.  You are so much better than this.  Where shall I start?  1. We arrived on time for our reservation.  It took them half an hour to seat us.  AND they did not mark us as arrived for our opentable reservation.  2. The staff - I understand that the Cosmopolitan focuses on young and beautiful.  I like that vibe.  But, when it comes to food, I want people who know food and love it.  The runner brought us a dish and said  here are your meatballs.   We didn't order meatballs, so we sent it away.  Our waiter brought it back to us and said  sorry, he doesn't know what the dish is called.   Seriously?  FIne dining staff should know!  3. There was a hair in my tortilla.  The manager (who was also a little on the young side) offered us a new one.  We declined, as we had so much more food coming and we found the hair towards the end.  She said  okay we'll take it off the bill.   That should go without saying.  If it was me, I'd give the table a free dessert or sangria, but that's fine.  4. Food was fired at a strange pace.  Okay, now the good - the food was mostly delicious.  The Ferran Adria olives are always amazing, the patatas bravas were unique and fun and I enjoyed the food overall.   The cocktails were amazing...   All this to say - grab a cocktail and a small plate or two at the bar.  The overall experience should have been far more elevated.

Reviews.Author: Jason
Reviews.Content: incredible experience.  most of the tapas were superb; a few were ok.  but the vibe, waitstaff, great tapas and wine motivate 5 stars.  i will 100% be back to this place during future vegas trips

Reviews.Author: Eric
Reviews.Content: There was nothing wrong with Jaleo but the problem was that there was also nothing overly right about it either. The food was above average I would say. The atmosphere was good as well. I don't expect big portions because after all it is tapas. The average price for a small plate is similar to a full entree elsewhere. The food presentation was not the caliber of the price as well. It's certainly 4 star worthy at half the price. When in Vegas there are so many better options at or near this price point.

Reviews.Author: david
Reviews.Content: Excellent food. We had probably 12 to 14 dishes and some were as good as anything I've ever had. It is a very unique menu and you can easily stray outside you culinary comfort zone and be pleasantly surprised at every turn. The veal cheeks, jamon iberico and spinach salad were off the chart good. There wasn't anything I wouldn't be willing to try here (High praise).  The service was good and the waiter's recommendations were all spot on. The only lag was before dessert and it was unnecessarily long. It was  can we go and just skip dessert  long. Glad we didn't because dessert was great too.  The biggest knock was where they sat us. We had a large party and they sat us outside the restaurant in a foyer area. The people watching was great but it was really loud and you felt like some drunk stranger was going to walk up and grab something off your plate.  Other than that, this was a 5 star experience.  Big smiley face.

Reviews.Author: Lily
